198 : monster()
199{
200 type = &id.obj();
201 moves = type->speed;
202 Creature::set_speed_base( type->speed );
203 hp = type->hp;
204 for( auto &sa : type->special_attacks ) {
205 auto &entry = special_attacks[sa.first];
206 entry.cooldown = rng( 0, sa.second->cooldown );
207 }
208 anger = type->agro;
209 morale = type->morale;
210 faction = type->default_faction;
211 ammo = type->starting_ammo;
212 upgrades = type->upgrades && ( type->half_life || type->age_grow );
213 reproduces = type->reproduces && type->baby_timer && !monster::has_flag( MF_NO_BREED );
214 if( monster::has_flag( MF_AQUATIC ) ) {
215 fish_population = dice( 1, 20 );
216 }
217 if( monster::has_flag( MF_RIDEABLE_MECH ) ) {
218 itype_id mech_bat = itype_id( type->mech_battery );
219 int max_charge = mech_bat->magazine->capacity;
220 item mech_bat_item = item( mech_bat, calendar::start_of_cataclysm );
221 mech_bat_item.ammo_consume( rng( 0, max_charge ), tripoint_zero );
222 battery_item = cata::make_value<item>( mech_bat_item );
223 }

◆ attack_at()

bool monster::attack_at ( const tripoint &  p)

Attack any enemies at the given location.

Attacks only if there is a creature at the given location towards we are hostile.

Returns
true if something was attacked, false otherwise

Definition at line 1483 of file monmove.cpp.

1484{
1485 if( has_flag( MF_PACIFIST ) ) {
1486 return false;
1487 }
1488 if( p.z != posz() ) {
1489 // TODO: Remove this
1490 return false;
1491 }
1492
1493 if( p == g->u.pos() ) {
1494 melee_attack( g->u );
1495 return true;
1496 }
1497
1498 if( const auto mon_ = g->critter_at<monster>( p, is_hallucination() ) ) {
1499 monster &mon = *mon_;
1500
1501 // Don't attack yourself.
1502 if( &mon == this ) {
1503 return false;
1504 }
1505
1506 // With no melee dice, we can't attack, but we had to process until here
1507 // because hallucinations require no melee dice to destroy.
1508 if( type->melee_dice <= 0 ) {
1509 return false;
1510 }
1511
1512 auto attitude = attitude_to( mon );
1513 // MF_ATTACKMON == hulk behavior, whack everything in your way
1514 if( attitude == A_HOSTILE || has_flag( MF_ATTACKMON ) ) {
1515 melee_attack( mon );
1516 return true;
1517 }
1518
1519 return false;
1520 }
1521
1522 npc *const guy = g->critter_at<npc>( p );
1523 if( guy && type->melee_dice > 0 ) {
1524 // For now we're always attacking NPCs that are getting into our
1525 // way. This is consistent with how it worked previously, but
1526 // later on not hitting allied NPCs would be cool.
1527 guy->on_attacked( *this ); // allow NPC hallucination to be one shot by monsters
1528 melee_attack( *guy );
1529 return true;
1530 }
1531
1532 // Nothing to attack.
1533 return false;
1534}

◆ attitude()

monster_attitude monster::attitude ( const Character *  u = nullptr) const

Definition at line 1086 of file monster.cpp.

1087{
1088 if( friendly != 0 ) {
1089 if( has_effect( effect_docile ) ) {
1090 return MATT_FPASSIVE;
1091 }
1092 if( u == &g->u ) {
1093 return MATT_FRIEND;
1094 }
1095 // Zombies don't understand not attacking NPCs, but dogs and bots should.
1096 const npc *np = dynamic_cast< const npc * >( u );
1097 if( np != nullptr && np->get_attitude() != NPCATT_KILL && !type->in_species( ZOMBIE ) ) {
1098 return MATT_FRIEND;
1099 }
1100 if( np != nullptr && np->is_hallucination() ) {
1101 return MATT_IGNORE;
1102 }
1103 }
1104 if( effect_cache[FLEEING] ) {
1105 return MATT_FLEE;
1106 }
1107 if( has_effect( effect_pacified ) ) {
1108 return MATT_ZLAVE;
1109 }
1110
1111 int effective_anger = anger;
1112 int effective_morale = morale;
1113
1114 if( u != nullptr ) {
1115 // Those are checked quite often, so avoiding string construction is a good idea
1116 static const string_id<monfaction> faction_bee( "bee" );
1117 if( faction == faction_bee ) {
1118 if( u->has_trait( trait_BEE ) ) {
1119 return MATT_FRIEND;
1120 } else if( u->has_trait( trait_FLOWERS ) ) {
1121 effective_anger -= 10;
1122 }
1123 }
1124
1125 if( type->in_species( FUNGUS ) && ( u->has_trait( trait_THRESH_MYCUS ) ||
1126 u->has_trait( trait_MYCUS_FRIEND ) ) ) {
1127 return MATT_FRIEND;
1128 }
1129
1130 if( effective_anger >= 10 &&
1131 ( ( type->in_species( MAMMAL ) && u->has_trait( trait_PHEROMONE_MAMMAL ) ) ||
1132 ( type->in_species( INSECT ) && u->has_trait( trait_PHEROMONE_INSECT ) ) ) ) {
1133 effective_anger -= 20;
1134 }
1135
1136 if( u->has_trait( trait_TERRIFYING ) ) {
1137 effective_morale -= 10;
1138 }
1139
1140 if( has_flag( MF_ANIMAL ) ) {
1141 if( u->has_trait( trait_ANIMALEMPATH ) ) {
1142 effective_anger -= 10;
1143 if( effective_anger < 10 ) {
1144 effective_morale += 55;
1145 }
1146 } else if( u->has_trait( trait_ANIMALEMPATH2 ) ) {
1147 effective_anger -= 20;
1148 if( effective_anger < 20 ) {
1149 effective_morale += 80;
1150 }
1151 } else if( u->has_trait( trait_ANIMALDISCORD ) ) {
1152 if( effective_anger >= 10 ) {
1153 effective_anger += 10;
1154 }
1155 if( effective_anger < 10 ) {
1156 effective_morale -= 5;
1157 }
1158 } else if( u->has_trait( trait_ANIMALDISCORD2 ) ) {
1159 if( effective_anger >= 20 ) {
1160 effective_anger += 20;
1161 }
1162 if( effective_anger < 20 ) {
1163 effective_morale -= 5;
1164 }
1165 }
1166 }
1167
1168 for( const trait_id &mut : u->get_mutations() ) {
1169 for( const std::pair<const species_id, int> &elem : mut.obj().anger_relations ) {
1170 if( type->in_species( elem.first ) ) {
1171 effective_anger += elem.second;
1172 }
1173 }
1174 }
1175
1176 for( const trait_id &mut : u->get_mutations() ) {
1177 for( const species_id &spe : mut.obj().ignored_by ) {
1178 if( type->in_species( spe ) ) {
1179 return MATT_IGNORE;
1180 }
1181 }
1182 }
1183 }
1184
1185 if( effective_morale < 0 ) {
1186 if( effective_morale + effective_anger > 0 && get_hp() > get_hp_max() / 3 ) {
1187 return MATT_FOLLOW;
1188 }
1189 return MATT_FLEE;
1190 }
1191
1192 if( effective_anger <= 0 ) {
1193 if( get_hp() <= 0.6 * get_hp_max() ) {
1194 return MATT_FLEE;
1195 } else {
1196 return MATT_IGNORE;
1197 }
1198 }
1199
1200 if( effective_anger < 10 ) {
1201 return MATT_FOLLOW;
1202 }
1203
1204 return MATT_ATTACK;

◆ attitude_to()

Creature::Attitude monster::attitude_to ( const Creature &  other) const
overridevirtual

Attitude (of this creature) towards another creature.

This might not be symmetric.

Implements Creature.

Definition at line 1040 of file monster.cpp.

1041{
1042 const monster *m = other.is_monster() ? static_cast< const monster *>( &other ) : nullptr;
1043 const player *p = other.as_player();
1044 if( m != nullptr ) {
1045 if( m == this ) {
1046 return A_FRIENDLY;
1047 }
1048
1049 auto faction_att = faction.obj().attitude( m->faction );
1050 if( ( friendly != 0 && m->friendly != 0 ) ||
1051 ( friendly == 0 && m->friendly == 0 && faction_att == MFA_FRIENDLY ) ) {
1052 // Friendly (to player) monsters are friendly to each other
1053 // Unfriendly monsters go by faction attitude
1054 return A_FRIENDLY;
1055 } else if( ( friendly == 0 && m->friendly == 0 && faction_att == MFA_HATE ) ) {
1056 // Stuff that hates a specific faction will always attack that faction
1057 return A_HOSTILE;
1058 } else if( ( friendly == 0 && m->friendly == 0 && faction_att == MFA_NEUTRAL ) ||
1059 morale < 0 || anger < 10 ) {
1060 // Stuff that won't attack is neutral to everything
1061 return A_NEUTRAL;
1062 } else {
1063 return A_HOSTILE;
1064 }
1065 } else if( p != nullptr ) {
1066 switch( attitude( const_cast<player *>( p ) ) ) {
1067 case MATT_FRIEND:
1068 case MATT_ZLAVE:
1069 return A_FRIENDLY;
1070 case MATT_FPASSIVE:
1071 case MATT_FLEE:
1072 case MATT_IGNORE:
1073 case MATT_FOLLOW:
1074 return A_NEUTRAL;
1075 case MATT_ATTACK:
1076 return A_HOSTILE;
1077 case MATT_NULL:
1078 case NUM_MONSTER_ATTITUDES:
1079 break;
1080 }
1081 }
1082 // Should not happen!, creature should be either player or monster
1083 return A_NEUTRAL;
1084}

◆ avoid_trap()

bool monster::avoid_trap ( const tripoint &  pos,
const trap &  tr 
) const
overridevirtual

Called when a creature triggers a trap, returns true if they don't set it off.

Parameters
tris the trap that was triggered.
posis the location of the trap (not necessarily of the creature) in the main map.

Implements Creature.

Definition at line 878 of file monster.cpp.

879{
880 // The trap position is not used, monsters are to stupid to remember traps. Actually, they do
881 // not even see them.
882 // Traps are on the ground, digging monsters go below, fliers and climbers go above.
883 if( digging() || flies() ) {
884 return true;
885 }
886 return dice( 3, type->sk_dodge + 1 ) >= dice( 3, tr.get_avoidance() );
887}

◆ bash_at()

bool monster::bash_at ( const tripoint &  p)

Try to smash/bash/destroy your way through the terrain at p.

Returns
true if we destroyed something, false otherwise.

Definition at line 1382 of file monmove.cpp.

1383{
1384 if( p.z != posz() ) {
1385 // TODO: Remove this

1387 }
1388

1390 if( is_hallucination() ) {
1391 return false;
1392 }
1393
1394 // Don't bash if a friendly monster is standing there
1395 monster *target = g->critter_at<monster>( p );
1396 if( target != nullptr && attitude_to( *target ) == A_FRIENDLY ) {
1397 return false;
1398 }
1399
1400 bool try_bash = !can_move_to( p ) || one_in( 3 );
1401 if( !try_bash ) {
1402 return false;
1403 }
1404
1405 bool can_bash = g->m.is_bashable( p ) && bash_skill() > 0;
1406 if( !can_bash ) {
1407 return false;
1408 }
1409
1410 bool flat_ground = g->m.has_flag( "ROAD", p ) || g->m.has_flag( "FLAT", p );
1411 if( flat_ground && !g->m.is_bashable_furn( p ) ) {
1412 bool can_bash_ter = g->m.is_bashable_ter( p );
1413 bool try_bash_ter = one_in( 50 );
1414 if( !( can_bash_ter && try_bash_ter ) ) {
1415 return false;
1416 }
1417 }
1418
1419 int bashskill = group_bash_skill( p );
1420 g->m.bash( p, bashskill );
1421 moves -= 100;
1422 return true;
1423}

◆ calc_movecost()

int monster::calc_movecost ( const tripoint &  f,
const tripoint &  t 
) const

Definition at line 1283 of file monmove.cpp.

1284{
1285 int movecost = 0;
1286
1287 const int source_cost = g->m.move_cost( f );
1288 const int dest_cost = g->m.move_cost( t );
1289 // Digging and flying monsters ignore terrain cost
1290 if( flies() || ( digging() && g->m.has_flag( "DIGGABLE", t ) ) ) {
1291 movecost = 100;
1292 // Swimming monsters move super fast in water
1293 } else if( swims() ) {
1294 if( g->m.has_flag( "SWIMMABLE", f ) ) {
1295 movecost += 25;
1296 } else {
1297 movecost += 50 * g->m.move_cost( f );
1298 }
1299 if( g->m.has_flag( "SWIMMABLE", t ) ) {
1300 movecost += 25;
1301 } else {
1302 movecost += 50 * g->m.move_cost( t );
1303 }
1304 } else if( can_submerge() ) {
1305 // No-breathe monsters have to walk underwater slowly
1306 if( g->m.has_flag( "SWIMMABLE", f ) ) {
1307 movecost += 250;
1308 } else {
1309 movecost += 50 * g->m.move_cost( f );
1310 }
1311 if( g->m.has_flag( "SWIMMABLE", t ) ) {
1312 movecost += 250;
1313 } else {
1314 movecost += 50 * g->m.move_cost( t );
1315 }
1316 movecost /= 2;
1317 } else if( climbs() ) {
1318 if( g->m.has_flag( "CLIMBABLE", f ) ) {
1319 movecost += 150;
1320 } else {
1321 movecost += 50 * g->m.move_cost( f );
1322 }
1323 if( g->m.has_flag( "CLIMBABLE", t ) ) {
1324 movecost += 150;
1325 } else {
1326 movecost += 50 * g->m.move_cost( t );
1327 }
1328 movecost /= 2;
1329 } else {
1330 movecost = ( ( 50 * source_cost ) + ( 50 * dest_cost ) ) / 2.0;
1331 }
1332
1333 return movecost;
1334}

bool swims() const

Definition: monster.cpp:904

◆ can_move_to()

bool monster::can_move_to ( const tripoint &  p) const

Checks whether we can move to/through p.

This does not account for bashing.

This is used in pathfinding and ONLY checks the terrain. It ignores players and monsters, which might only block this tile temporarily. will_move_to() checks for impassable terrain etc can_reach_to() checks for z-level difference. can_move_to() is a wrapper for both of them. can_squeeze_to() checks for vehicle holes.

Definition at line 258 of file monmove.cpp.

259{
260 return can_reach_to( p ) && will_move_to( p );
261}
monster::can_reach_to
bool can_reach_to(const tripoint &p) const
Definition: monmove.cpp:230
monster::will_move_to
bool will_move_to(const tripoint &p) const
Definition: monmove.cpp:119

References can_reach_to(), and will_move_to().

Referenced by bash_at(), mattack::grab_drag(), move(), move_to(), push_to(), scent_move(), map::spawn_monsters_submap(), stumble(), and game::update_stair_monsters().

◆ can_reach_to()

bool monster::can_reach_to ( const tripoint &  p) const

Definition at line 230 of file monmove.cpp.

231{
232 map &here = get_map();
233 if( p.z > pos().z && z_is_valid( pos().z ) ) {
234 if( here.has_flag( TFLAG_RAMP_UP, tripoint( p.xy(), p.z - 1 ) ) ) {
235 return true;
236 }
237 if( !here.has_flag( TFLAG_GOES_UP, pos() ) && !here.has_flag( TFLAG_NO_FLOOR, p ) ) {
238 // can't go through the roof
239 return false;
240 }
241 } else if( p.z < pos().z && z_is_valid( pos().z ) ) {
242 if( !here.has_flag( TFLAG_GOES_DOWN, pos() ) ) {
243 // can't go through the floor
244 // you would fall anyway if there was no floor, so no need to check for that here
245 return false;
246 }
247 }
248 return true;
249}

2413 return false;
2414 }
2415 const itype &type = *battery_item->type;
2416 if( battery_item->ammo_remaining() <= type.magazine->capacity / 10 && one_in( 10 ) ) {
2417 add_msg( m_bad, _( "Your %s emits a beeping noise as its batteries start to get low." ),
2418 get_name() );
2419 }
2420 return true;
2421}

1598{
1599 switch( du.type ) {
1600 case DT_ELECTRIC:
1601 if( has_flag( MF_ELECTRIC ) ) {
1602 return; // immunity
1603 }
1604 break;
1605 case DT_COLD:
1606 if( has_flag( MF_COLDPROOF ) ) {
1607 return; // immunity
1608 }
1609 break;
1610 case DT_BASH:
1611 if( has_flag( MF_PLASTIC ) ) {
1612 damage += du.amount / rng( 2, 4 ); // lessened effect
1613 pain += du.amount / 4;
1614 return;
1615 }
1616 break;
1617 case DT_NULL:
1618 debugmsg( "monster::deal_damage_handle_type: illegal damage type DT_NULL" );
1619 break;
1620 case DT_ACID:
1621 if( has_flag( MF_ACIDPROOF ) ) {
1622 // immunity
1623 return;
1624 }
1625 case DT_TRUE:
1626 // typeless damage, should always go through
1627 case DT_BIOLOGICAL:
1628 // internal damage, like from smoke or poison
1629 case DT_CUT:
1630 case DT_STAB:
1631 case DT_BULLET:
1632 case DT_HEAT:
1633 default:
1634 break;
1635 }

2339 // submap coordinates.

2351 mission::on_creature_death( *this );
2352 // Also, perform our death function
2353 if( is_hallucination() || summon_time_limit ) {
2354 //Hallucinations always just disappear
2355 mdeath::disappear( *this );
2356 return;
2357 }
2358
2359 //Not a hallucination, go process the death effects.
2360 for( const auto &deathfunction : type->dies ) {
2361 deathfunction( *this );
2362 }
2363
2364 // If our species fears seeing one of our own die, process that
2365 int anger_adjust = 0;
2366 int morale_adjust = 0;
2367 if( type->has_anger_trigger( mon_trigger::FRIEND_DIED ) ) {
2368 anger_adjust += 15;
2369 }
2370 if( type->has_fear_trigger( mon_trigger::FRIEND_DIED ) ) {
2371 morale_adjust -= 15;
2372 }
2373 if( type->has_placate_trigger( mon_trigger::FRIEND_DIED ) ) {
2374 anger_adjust -= 15;
2375 }
2376
2377 if( anger_adjust != 0 || morale_adjust != 0 ) {
2378 int light = g->light_level( posz() );
2379 for( monster &critter : g->all_monsters() ) {
2380 if( !critter.type->same_species( *type ) ) {
2381 continue;
2382 }
2383
2384 if( g->m.sees( critter.pos(), pos(), light ) ) {
2385 critter.morale += morale_adjust;
2386 critter.anger += anger_adjust;
2387 }
2388 }
2389 }

◆ drop_items_on_death()

void monster::drop_items_on_death ( )

Definition at line 2448 of file monster.cpp.

2449{
2450 if( is_hallucination() ) {
2451 return;
2452 }
2453 if( !type->death_drops ) {
2454 return;
2455 }
2456
2457 std::vector<item> items = item_group::items_from( type->death_drops, calendar::start_of_cataclysm );
2458
2459 // This block removes some items, according to item spawn scaling factor
2460 const float spawn_rate = get_option<float>( "ITEM_SPAWNRATE" );
2461 if( spawn_rate < 1 ) {
2462 // Temporary vector, to remember which items will be dropped
2463 std::vector<item> remaining;
2464 for( const item &it : items ) {
2465 if( rng_float( 0, 1 ) < spawn_rate ) {
2466 remaining.push_back( it );
2467 }
2468 }
2469 // If there aren't any items left, there's nothing left to do
2470 if( remaining.empty() ) {
2471 return;
2472 }
2473 items = remaining;
2474 }
2475
2476 const auto dropped = g->m.spawn_items( pos(), items );
2477
2478 if( has_flag( MF_FILTHY ) && get_option<bool>( "FILTHY_CLOTHES" ) ) {
2479 for( const auto &it : dropped ) {
2480 if( ( it->is_armor() || it->is_pet_armor() ) && !it->is_gun() ) {
2481 // handle wearable guns as a special case
2482 it->set_flag( "FILTHY" );
2483 }
2484 }
2485 }
2486}

◆ find_dragged_foe()

player * monster::find_dragged_foe ( )
private

Definition at line 1088 of file monmove.cpp.

1089{
1090 // Make sure they're actually dragging someone.
1091 if( !dragged_foe_id.is_valid() || !has_effect( effect_dragging ) ) {
1092 dragged_foe_id = character_id();
1093 return nullptr;
1094 }
1095
1096 // Dragged critters may die or otherwise become invalid, which is why we look
1097 // them up each time. Luckily, monsters dragging critters is relatively rare,
1098 // so this check should happen infrequently.
1099 player *dragged_foe = g->critter_by_id<player>( dragged_foe_id );
1100
1101 if( dragged_foe == nullptr ) {
1102 // Target no longer valid.
1103 dragged_foe_id = character_id();
1104 remove_effect( effect_dragging );
1105 }
1106
1107 return dragged_foe;
1108}

void monster::footsteps ( const tripoint &  p)

Definition at line 1166 of file monmove.cpp.

1167{
1168 if( made_footstep ) {
1169 return;
1170 }
1171 made_footstep = true;
1172 int volume = 6; // same as player's footsteps
1173 if( flies() ) {
1174 volume = 0; // Flying monsters don't have footsteps!
1175 }
1176 if( digging() ) {
1177 volume = 10;
1178 }
1179 switch( type->size ) {
1180 case MS_TINY:
1181 volume = 0; // No sound for the tinies
1182 break;
1183 case MS_SMALL:
1184 volume /= 3;
1185 break;
1186 case MS_MEDIUM:
1187 break;
1188 case MS_LARGE:
1189 volume *= 1.5;
1190 break;
1191 case MS_HUGE:
1192 volume *= 2;
1193 break;
1194 default:
1195 break;
1196 }
1197 if( has_flag( MF_LOUDMOVES ) ) {
1198 volume += 6;
1199 }
1200 if( volume == 0 ) {
1201 return;
1202 }
1203 int dist = rl_dist( p, g->u.pos() );
1204 sounds::add_footstep( p, volume, dist, this, type->get_footsteps() );
1205 return;

◆ get_armor_type()

int monster::get_armor_type ( damage_type  dt,

) const
overridevirtual

1893{
1894 int worn_armor = get_worn_armor_val( dt );
1895
1896 switch( dt ) {
1897 case DT_TRUE:
1898 case DT_BIOLOGICAL:
1899 return 0;
1900 case DT_BASH:
1901 return get_armor_bash( bp );
1902 case DT_CUT:
1903 return get_armor_cut( bp );
1904 case DT_BULLET:
1905 return get_armor_bullet( bp );
1906 case DT_ACID:
1907 return worn_armor + static_cast<int>( type->armor_acid );
1908 case DT_STAB:
1909 return worn_armor + static_cast<int>( type->armor_stab ) + armor_cut_bonus * 0.8f;
1910 case DT_HEAT:
1911 return worn_armor + static_cast<int>( type->armor_fire );
1912 case DT_COLD:
1913 case DT_ELECTRIC:
1914 return worn_armor;
1915 case DT_NULL:
1916 case NUM_DT:
1917 // Let it error below
1918 break;
1919 }
1920
1921 debugmsg( "Invalid damage type: %d", dt );
1922 return 0;
1923}

int get_armor_bullet(bodypart_id bp) const override
Definition: monster.cpp:1885

◆ group_bash_skill()

int monster::group_bash_skill ( const tripoint &  target)

Returns ability of monster and any cooperative helpers to bash the designated target.


Definition at line 1441 of file monmove.cpp.

1442{
1443 if( !has_flag( MF_GROUP_BASH ) ) {
1444 return bash_skill();
1445 }
1446 int bashskill = 0;
1447
1448 // pileup = more bash skill, but only help bashing mob directly in front of target
1449 const int max_helper_depth = 5;
1450 const std::vector<tripoint> bzone = get_bashing_zone( target, pos(), max_helper_depth );
1451
1452 for( const tripoint &candidate : bzone ) {
1453 // Drawing this line backwards excludes the target and includes the candidate.
1454 std::vector<tripoint> path_to_target = line_to( target, candidate, 0, 0 );
1455 bool connected = true;
1456 monster *mon = nullptr;
1457 for( const tripoint &in_path : path_to_target ) {
1458 // If any point in the line from zombie to target is not a cooperating zombie,
1459 // it can't contribute.
1460 mon = g->critter_at<monster>( in_path );
1461 if( !mon ) {
1462 connected = false;
1463 break;
1464 }
1465 monster &helpermon = *mon;
1466 if( !helpermon.has_flag( MF_GROUP_BASH ) || helpermon.is_hallucination() ) {
1467 connected = false;
1468 break;
1469 }
1470 }
1471 if( !connected || !mon ) {
1472 continue;
1473 }
1474 // If we made it here, the last monster checked was the candidate.
1475 monster &helpermon = *mon;
1476 // Contribution falls off rapidly with distance from target.
1477 bashskill += helpermon.bash_skill() / rl_dist( candidate, target );
1478 }
1479
1480 return bashskill;
1481}
line_to
std::vector< coords::coord_point< Point, Origin, Scale > > line_to(const coords::coord_point< Point, Origin, Scale > &loc1, const coords::coord_point< Point, Origin, Scale > &loc2)
Definition: coordinates.h:548
get_bashing_zone
static std::vector< tripoint > get_bashing_zone(const tripoint &bashee, const tripoint &basher, int maxdepth)
Definition: monmove.cpp:1356

References bash_skill(), g, get_bashing_zone(), has_flag(), is_hallucination(), line_to(), MF_GROUP_BASH, pos(), and rl_dist().

Referenced by bash_at().

◆ heal()

int monster::heal ( int  delta_hp,

)

Flat addition to the monsters hp.

If overheal is true, this is not capped by max hp. Returns actually healed hp.

1641{

1644 return 0;

◆ hear_sound()

void monster::hear_sound ( const tripoint &  source,
int  vol,
int  distance 
)

Makes monster react to heard sound.

Parameters
sourceLocation of the sound source
volVolume at the center of the sound source
distanceDistance to sound source (currently just rl_dist)

Definition at line 2927 of file monster.cpp.

2928{
2929 if( !can_hear() ) {
2930 return;
2931 }
2932
2933 const bool goodhearing = has_flag( MF_GOODHEARING );
2934 const int volume = goodhearing ? 2 * vol - dist : vol - dist;
2935 // Error is based on volume, louder sound = less error
2936 if( volume <= 0 ) {
2937 return;
2938 }
2939
2940 int max_error = 0;
2941 if( volume < 2 ) {
2942 max_error = 10;
2943 } else if( volume < 5 ) {
2944 max_error = 5;
2945 } else if( volume < 10 ) {
2946 max_error = 3;
2947 } else if( volume < 20 ) {
2948 max_error = 1;
2949 }
2950
2951 int target_x = source.x + rng( -max_error, max_error );
2952 int target_y = source.y + rng( -max_error, max_error );
2953 // target_z will require some special check due to soil muffling sounds
2954
2955 int wander_turns = volume * ( goodhearing ? 6 : 1 );
2956
2957 process_trigger( mon_trigger::SOUND, volume );
2958 if( morale >= 0 && anger >= 10 ) {
2959 // TODO: Add a proper check for fleeing attitude
2960 // but cache it nicely, because this part is called a lot
2961 wander_to( tripoint( target_x, target_y, source.z ), wander_turns );
2962 } else if( morale < 0 ) {
2963 // Monsters afraid of sound should not go towards sound
2964 wander_to( tripoint( 2 * posx() - target_x, 2 * posy() - target_y, 2 * posz() - source.z ),
2965 wander_turns );
2966 }
2967}
monster::can_hear
bool can_hear() const
Definition: monster.cpp:899
monster::posy
int posy() const override
Definition: monster.h:497
monster::posx
int posx() const override
Definition: monster.h:494

Definition: monmove.cpp:276
mon_trigger::SOUND
@ SOUND
MF_GOODHEARING
@ MF_GOODHEARING
Definition: mtype.h:69

◆ init_from_item()

void monster::init_from_item ( const item &  itm)

Initialize values like speed / hp from data of an item.

This applies to robotic monsters that are spawned by invoking an item (e.g. turret), and to reviving monsters that spawn from a corpse.

Definition at line 2782 of file monster.cpp.

2783{
2784 if( itm.typeId() == itype_corpse ) {
2785 set_speed_base( get_speed_base() * 0.8 );
2786 const int burnt_penalty = itm.burnt;
2787 hp = static_cast<int>( hp * 0.7 );
2788 if( itm.damage_level( 4 ) > 0 ) {
2789 set_speed_base( speed_base / ( itm.damage_level( 4 ) + 1 ) );
2790 hp /= itm.damage_level( 4 ) + 1;
2791 }
2792
2793 hp -= burnt_penalty;
2794
2795 // HP can be 0 or less, in this case revive_corpse will just deactivate the corpse
2796 if( hp > 0 && type->has_flag( MF_REVIVES_HEALTHY ) ) {
2797 hp = type->hp;
2798 set_speed_base( type->speed );
2799 }
2800 const std::string up_time = itm.get_var( "upgrade_time" );
2801 if( !up_time.empty() ) {
2802 upgrade_time = std::stoi( up_time );
2803 }
2804 } else {
2805 // must be a robot
2806 const int damfac = itm.max_damage() - std::max( 0, itm.damage() ) + 1;
2807 // One hp at least, everything else would be unfair (happens only to monster with *very* low hp),
2808 hp = std::max( 1, hp * damfac / ( itm.max_damage() + 1 ) );
2809 }
2810}

◆ is_immune_field()

bool monster::is_immune_field ( const field_type_id &  ) const
overridevirtual

Returns true if we are immune to the field type with the given fid.

Does not handle intensity, so this function should only be called through is_dangerous_field().

Reimplemented from Creature.

Definition at line 83 of file monmove.cpp.

84{
85 if( fid == fd_fungal_haze ) {
86 return has_flag( MF_NO_BREATHE ) || type->in_species( FUNGUS );
87 }
88 if( fid == fd_fungicidal_gas ) {
89 return !type->in_species( FUNGUS );
90 }
91 if( fid == fd_insecticidal_gas ) {
92 return !type->in_species( INSECT ) && !type->in_species( SPIDER );
93 }
94 const field_type &ft = fid.obj();
95 if( ft.has_fume ) {
96 return has_flag( MF_NO_BREATHE );
97 }
98 if( ft.has_acid ) {
99 return has_flag( MF_ACIDPROOF ) || flies();
100 }
101 if( ft.has_fire ) {
102 return has_flag( MF_FIREPROOF );
103 }
104 if( ft.has_elec ) {
105 return has_flag( MF_ELECTRIC );
106 }
107 if( ft.immune_mtypes.count( type->id ) > 0 ) {
108 return true;
109 }
110 // No specific immunity was found, so fall upwards
111 return Creature::is_immune_field( fid );
112}

◆ knock_back_to()

void monster::knock_back_to ( const tripoint &  to)
overridevirtual

Knocks the creature to a specified tile.

Implements Creature.

Definition at line 1940 of file monmove.cpp.

1941{
1942 if( to == pos() ) {
1943 return; // No effect
1944 }
1945
1946 if( is_hallucination() ) {
1947 die( nullptr );
1948 return;
1949 }
1950
1951 bool u_see = g->u.sees( to );
1952
1953 // First, see if we hit another monster
1954 if( monster *const z = g->critter_at<monster>( to ) ) {
1955 apply_damage( z, bodypart_id( "torso" ), z->type->size );
1956 add_effect( effect_stunned, 1_turns );
1957 if( type->size > 1 + z->type->size ) {
1958 z->knock_back_from( pos() ); // Chain reaction!
1959 z->apply_damage( this, bodypart_id( "torso" ), type->size );
1960 z->add_effect( effect_stunned, 1_turns );
1961 } else if( type->size > z->type->size ) {
1962 z->apply_damage( this, bodypart_id( "torso" ), type->size );
1963 z->add_effect( effect_stunned, 1_turns );
1964 }
1965 z->check_dead_state();
1966
1967 if( u_see ) {
1968 add_msg( _( "The %1$s bounces off a %2$s!" ), name(), z->name() );
1969 }
1970
1971 return;
1972 }
1973
1974 if( npc *const p = g->critter_at<npc>( to ) ) {
1975 apply_damage( p, bodypart_id( "torso" ), 3 );
1976 add_effect( effect_stunned, 1_turns );
1977 p->deal_damage( this, bodypart_id( "torso" ), damage_instance( DT_BASH, type->size ) );
1978 if( u_see ) {
1979 add_msg( _( "The %1$s bounces off %2$s!" ), name(), p->name );
1980 }
1981
1982 p->check_dead_state();
1983 return;
1984 }
1985
1986 // If we're still in the function at this point, we're actually moving a tile!
1987 // die_if_drowning will kill the monster if necessary, but if the deep water
1988 // tile is on a vehicle, we should check for swimmers out of water
1989 if( !die_if_drowning( to ) && has_flag( MF_AQUATIC ) ) {
1990 die( nullptr );
1991 if( u_see ) {
1992 add_msg( _( "The %s flops around and dies!" ), name() );
1993 }
1994 }
1995
1996 if( g->m.impassable( to ) ) {
1997
1998 // It's some kind of wall.
1999 apply_damage( nullptr, bodypart_id( "torso" ), type->size );
2000 add_effect( effect_stunned, 2_turns );
2001 if( u_see ) {
2002 add_msg( _( "The %1$s bounces off a %2$s." ), name(),
2003 g->m.obstacle_name( to ) );
2004 }
2005
2006 } else { // It's no wall
2007 setpos( to );
2008 }
2009 check_dead_state();
2010}

◆ load()

void monster::load ( const JsonObject &  data)
protected

Definition at line 1775 of file savegame_json.cpp.

1776{
1777 Creature::load( data );
1778
1779 std::string sidtmp;
1780 // load->str->int
1781 data.read( "typeid", sidtmp );
1782 type = &mtype_id( sidtmp ).obj();
1783
1784 data.read( "unique_name", unique_name );
1785 data.read( "posx", position.x );
1786 data.read( "posy", position.y );
1787 if( !data.read( "posz", position.z ) ) {
1788 position.z = g->get_levz();
1789 }
1790
1791 data.read( "wandf", wandf );
1792 data.read( "wandx", wander_pos.x );
1793 data.read( "wandy", wander_pos.y );
1794 if( data.read( "wandz", wander_pos.z ) ) {
1795 wander_pos.z = position.z;
1796 }
1797 if( data.has_object( "tied_item" ) ) {
1798 JsonIn *tied_item_json = data.get_raw( "tied_item" );
1799 item newitem;
1800 newitem.deserialize( *tied_item_json );
1801 tied_item = cata::make_value<item>( newitem );
1802 }
1803 if( data.has_object( "tack_item" ) ) {
1804 JsonIn *tack_item_json = data.get_raw( "tack_item" );
1805 item newitem;
1806 newitem.deserialize( *tack_item_json );
1807 tack_item = cata::make_value<item>( newitem );
1808 }
1809 if( data.has_object( "armor_item" ) ) {
1810 JsonIn *armor_item_json = data.get_raw( "armor_item" );
1811 item newitem;
1812 newitem.deserialize( *armor_item_json );
1813 armor_item = cata::make_value<item>( newitem );
1814 }
1815 if( data.has_object( "storage_item" ) ) {
1816 JsonIn *storage_item_json = data.get_raw( "storage_item" );
1817 item newitem;
1818 newitem.deserialize( *storage_item_json );
1819 storage_item = cata::make_value<item>( newitem );
1820 }
1821 if( data.has_object( "battery_item" ) ) {
1822 JsonIn *battery_item_json = data.get_raw( "battery_item" );
1823 item newitem;
1824 newitem.deserialize( *battery_item_json );
1825 battery_item = cata::make_value<item>( newitem );
1826 }
1827 data.read( "hp", hp );
1828
1829 // sp_timeout indicates an old save, prior to the special_attacks refactor
1830 if( data.has_array( "sp_timeout" ) ) {
1831 JsonArray parray = data.get_array( "sp_timeout" );
1832 size_t index = 0;
1833 int ptimeout = 0;
1834 while( parray.has_more() && index < type->special_attacks_names.size() ) {
1835 if( parray.read_next( ptimeout ) ) {
1836 // assume timeouts saved in same order as current monsters.json listing
1837 const std::string &aname = type->special_attacks_names[index++];
1838 auto &entry = special_attacks[aname];
1839 if( ptimeout >= 0 ) {
1840 entry.cooldown = ptimeout;
1841 } else { // -1 means disabled, unclear what <-1 values mean in old saves
1842 entry.cooldown = type->special_attacks.at( aname )->cooldown;
1843 entry.enabled = false;
1844 }
1845 }
1846 }
1847 }
1848
1849 // special_attacks indicates a save after the special_attacks refactor
1850 if( data.has_object( "special_attacks" ) ) {
1851 for( const JsonMember member : data.get_object( "special_attacks" ) ) {
1852 JsonObject saobject = member.get_object();
1853 saobject.allow_omitted_members();
1854 auto &entry = special_attacks[member.name()];
1855 entry.cooldown = saobject.get_int( "cooldown" );
1856 entry.enabled = saobject.get_bool( "enabled" );
1857 }
1858 }
1859
1860 // make sure the loaded monster has every special attack its type says it should have
1861 for( auto &sa : type->special_attacks ) {
1862 const std::string &aname = sa.first;
1863 if( special_attacks.find( aname ) == special_attacks.end() ) {
1864 auto &entry = special_attacks[aname];
1865 entry.cooldown = rng( 0, sa.second->cooldown );
1866 }
1867 }
1868
1869 data.read( "friendly", friendly );
1870 data.read( "mission_id", mission_id );
1871 data.read( "no_extra_death_drops", no_extra_death_drops );
1872 data.read( "dead", dead );
1873 data.read( "anger", anger );
1874 data.read( "morale", morale );
1875 data.read( "hallucination", hallucination );
1876 data.read( "stairscount", staircount ); // really?
1877 data.read( "fish_population", fish_population );
1878 // Load legacy plans.
1879 std::vector<tripoint> plans;
1880 data.read( "plans", plans );
1881 if( !plans.empty() ) {
1882 goal = plans.back();
1883 }
1884
1885 data.read( "summon_time_limit", summon_time_limit );
1886
1887 // This is relative to the monster so it isn't invalidated by map shifting.
1888 tripoint destination;
1889 data.read( "destination", destination );
1890 goal = pos() + destination;
1891
1892 upgrades = data.get_bool( "upgrades", type->upgrades );
1893 upgrade_time = data.get_int( "upgrade_time", -1 );
1894
1895 reproduces = data.get_bool( "reproduces", type->reproduces );
1896 baby_timer.reset();
1897 data.read( "baby_timer", baby_timer );
1898 if( baby_timer && *baby_timer == calendar::before_time_starts ) {
1899 baby_timer.reset();
1900 }
1901
1902 data.read( "udder_timer", udder_timer );
1903
1904 horde_attraction = static_cast<monster_horde_attraction>( data.get_int( "horde_attraction", 0 ) );
1905
1906 data.read( "inv", inv );
1907 data.read( "corpse_components", corpse_components );
1908 data.read( "dragged_foe_id", dragged_foe_id );
1909
1910 if( data.has_int( "ammo" ) && !type->starting_ammo.empty() ) {
1911 // Legacy loading for ammo.
1912 normalize_ammo( data.get_int( "ammo" ) );
1913 } else {
1914 data.read( "ammo", ammo );
1915 // legacy loading for milkable creatures, fix mismatch.
1916 if( has_flag( MF_MILKABLE ) && !type->starting_ammo.empty() && !ammo.empty() &&
1917 type->starting_ammo.begin()->first != ammo.begin()->first ) {
1918 const itype_id old_type = ammo.begin()->first;
1919 const int old_value = ammo.begin()->second;
1920 ammo[type->starting_ammo.begin()->first] = old_value;
1921 ammo.erase( old_type );
1922 }
1923 }
1924
1925 faction = mfaction_str_id( data.get_string( "faction", "" ) );
1926 if( !data.read( "last_updated", last_updated ) ) {
1927 last_updated = calendar::turn;
1928 }
1929 data.read( "mounted_player_id", mounted_player_id );
1930 data.read( "path", path );
1931}

1488 }
1489 } else {

1516 body_part_name_accusative( bp_hit ), target.skin_name() );
1517 }
1518 }
1519

1521

1523 if( one_in( 7 ) ) {
1524 die( nullptr );
1525 }
1526 return;
1527 }
1528
1529 if( total_dealt <= 0 ) {
1530 return;
1531 }
1532
1533 // Add any on damage effects
1534 for( const auto &eff : type->atk_effs ) {
1535 if( x_in_y( eff.chance, 100 ) ) {
1536 const body_part affected_bp = eff.affect_hit_bp ? bp_hit : eff.bp;
1537 target.add_effect( eff.id, time_duration::from_turns( eff.duration ), affected_bp );
1538 if( eff.permanent ) {
1539 target.get_effect( eff.id, affected_bp ).set_permanent();
1540 }
1541 }
1542 }
1543
1544 const int stab_cut = dealt_dam.type_damage( DT_CUT ) + dealt_dam.type_damage( DT_STAB );

1546 if( stab_cut > 0 && has_flag( MF_VENOM ) ) {
1547 target.add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "You're envenomed!" ) );
1548 target.add_effect( effect_poison, 3_minutes );
1549 }
1550

1552 target.add_msg_if_player( m_bad,
1553 _( "You feel venom flood your body, wracking you with pain" ) );
1554 target.add_effect( effect_badpoison, 4_minutes );
1555 }
1556
1557 if( stab_cut > 0 && has_flag( MF_PARALYZE ) ) {
1558 target.add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "You feel venom enter your body!" ) );
1559 target.add_effect( effect_paralyzepoison, 10_minutes );
1560 }
1561
1562 if( total_dealt > 6 && stab_cut > 0 && has_flag( MF_BLEED ) ) {
1563 // Maybe should only be if DT_CUT > 6... Balance question
1564 target.add_effect( effect_bleed, 6_minutes, bp_hit );
1565 }

References _, Creature::A_FRIENDLY, damage_instance::add_damage(), Creature::add_effect(), add_effect(), add_msg(), Creature::add_msg_if_player(), mtype::atk_effs, mtype::attack_cost, body_part_name_accusative(), dealt_damage_instance::bp_hit, can_squeeze_to(), Creature::check_dead_state(), Creature::deal_melee_attack(), Creature::deal_melee_hit(), dice(), die(), Creature::disp_name(), disp_name(), sfx::do_player_death_hurt(), DT_BASH, DT_CUT, DT_STAB, effect_badpoison, effect_bleed, effect_hit_by_player, effect_paralyzepoison, effect_poison, effect_ridden, effect_run, time_duration::from_turns(), g, Creature::get_effect(), sfx::get_heard_volume(), get_name(), Creature::has_effect(), has_flag(), Creature::in_sleep_state(), is_hallucination(), Creature::is_npc(), Creature::is_player(), m_bad, m_good, mtype::melee_damage, mtype::melee_dice, melee::melee_hit_range(), mtype::melee_sides, MF_BADVENOM, MF_BLEED, MF_HIT_AND_RUN, MF_PARALYZE, MF_RIDEABLE_MECH, MF_VENOM, Creature::mod_moves(), name(), one_in(), sfx::play_variant_sound(), Creature::pos(), pos(), effect::set_permanent(), Creature::skin_name(), dealt_damage_instance::total_damage(), type, dealt_damage_instance::type_damage(), and x_in_y().

◆ move()

void monster::move ( )

Definition at line 678 of file monmove.cpp.

679{
680 // We decrement wandf no matter what. We'll save our wander_to plans until
681 // after we finish out set_dest plans, UNLESS they time out first.
682 if( wandf > 0 ) {
683 wandf--;
684 }
685
686 //Hallucinations have a chance of disappearing each turn
687 if( is_hallucination() && one_in( 25 ) ) {
688 die( nullptr );
689 return;
690 }
691 map &here = get_map();
692
693 behavior::monster_oracle_t oracle( this );
694 behavior::tree goals;
695 goals.add( type->get_goals() );
696 std::string action = goals.tick( &oracle );
697 //The monster can consume objects it stands on. Check if there are any.
698 //If there are. Consume them.
699 // TODO: Stick this in a map and dispatch to it via the action string.
700 if( action == "consume_items" ) {
701 if( g->u.sees( *this ) ) {
702 add_msg( _( "The %s flows around the objects on the floor and they are quickly dissolved!" ),
703 name() );
704 }
705 static const auto volume_per_hp = 250_ml;
706 for( auto &elem : g->m.i_at( pos() ) ) {
707 hp += elem.volume() / volume_per_hp; // Yeah this means it can get more HP than normal.
708 if( has_flag( MF_ABSORBS_SPLITS ) ) {
709 while( hp / 2 > type->hp ) {
710 monster *const spawn = g->place_critter_around( type->id, pos(), 1 );
711 if( !spawn ) {
712 break;
713 }
714 hp -= type->hp;
715 //this is a new copy of the monster. Ideally we should copy the stats/effects that affect the parent
716 spawn->make_ally( *this );
717 if( g->u.sees( *this ) ) {
718 add_msg( _( "The %s splits in two!" ), name() );
719 }
720 }
721 }
722 }
723 g->m.i_clear( pos() );
724 }
725 // record position before moving to put the player there if we're dragging
726 tripoint drag_to = g->m.getabs( pos() );
727
728 const bool pacified = has_effect( effect_pacified );
729
730 // First, use the special attack, if we can!
731 // The attack may change `monster::special_attacks` (e.g. by transforming
732 // this into another monster type). Therefore we can not iterate over it
733 // directly and instead iterate over the map from the monster type
734 // (properties of monster types should never change).
735 for( const auto &sp_type : type->special_attacks ) {
736 const std::string &special_name = sp_type.first;
737 const auto local_iter = special_attacks.find( special_name );
738 if( local_iter == special_attacks.end() ) {
739 continue;
740 }
741 mon_special_attack &local_attack_data = local_iter->second;
742 if( !local_attack_data.enabled ) {
743 continue;
744 }
745
746 // Cooldowns are decremented in monster::process_turn
747
748 if( local_attack_data.cooldown == 0 && !pacified && !is_hallucination() ) {
749 if( !sp_type.second->call( *this ) ) {
750 continue;
751 }
752
753 // `special_attacks` might have changed at this point. Sadly `reset_special`
754 // doesn't check the attack name, so we need to do it here.
755 if( special_attacks.count( special_name ) == 0 ) {
756 continue;
757 }
758 reset_special( special_name );
759 }
760 }
761
762 // Check if they're dragging a foe and find their hapless victim
763 player *dragged_foe = find_dragged_foe();
764
765 // Give nursebots a chance to do surgery.
766 nursebot_operate( dragged_foe );
767
768 // The monster can sometimes hang in air due to last fall being blocked
769 if( !flies() && g->m.has_flag( TFLAG_NO_FLOOR, pos() ) ) {
770 g->m.creature_on_trap( *this, false );
771 if( is_dead() ) {
772 return;
773 }
774 }
775
776 // if the monster is in a deep water tile, it has a chance to drown
777 if( die_if_drowning( pos(), 10 ) ) {
778 return;
779 }
780
781 if( moves < 0 ) {
782 return;
783 }
784
785 // TODO: Move this to attack_at/move_to/etc. functions
786 bool attacking = false;
787 if( !move_effects( attacking ) ) {
788 moves = 0;
789 return;
790 }
791 if( has_flag( MF_IMMOBILE ) || has_flag( MF_RIDEABLE_MECH ) ) {
792 moves = 0;
793 return;
794 }
795 if( has_effect( effect_stunned ) ) {
796 stumble();
797 moves = 0;
798 return;
799 }
800 if( friendly > 0 ) {
801 --friendly;
802 }
803 if( has_effect( effect_ai_waiting ) ) {
804 moves = 0;
805 return;
806 }
807
808 // don't move if a passenger in a moving vehicle
809 auto vp = g->m.veh_at( pos() );
810 bool harness_part = static_cast<bool>( g->m.veh_at( pos() ).part_with_feature( "ANIMAL_CTRL",
811 true ) );
812 if( vp && vp->vehicle().is_moving() && vp->vehicle().get_pet( vp->part_index() ) ) {
813 moves = 0;
814 return;
815 // Don't move if harnessed, even if vehicle is stationary
816 } else if( vp && has_effect( effect_harnessed ) ) {
817 moves = 0;
818 return;
819 // If harnessed monster finds itself moved from the harness point, the harness probably broke!
820 } else if( !harness_part && has_effect( effect_harnessed ) ) {
821 remove_effect( effect_harnessed );
822 }
823 // Set attitude to attitude to our current target
824 monster_attitude current_attitude = attitude( nullptr );
825 if( !wander() ) {
826 if( goal == g->u.pos() ) {
827 current_attitude = attitude( &g->u );
828 } else {
829 for( const npc &guy : g->all_npcs() ) {
830 if( goal == guy.pos() ) {
831 current_attitude = attitude( &guy );
832 }
833 }
834 }
835 }
836
837 if( current_attitude == MATT_IGNORE ||
838 ( current_attitude == MATT_FOLLOW && rl_dist( pos(), goal ) <= MONSTER_FOLLOW_DIST ) ) {
839 moves -= 100;
840 stumble();
841 return;
842 }
843
844 bool moved = false;
845 tripoint destination;
846
847 bool try_to_move = false;
848 for( const tripoint &dest : g->m.points_in_radius( pos(), 1 ) ) {
849 if( dest != pos() ) {
850 if( can_move_to( dest ) && can_squeeze_to( dest ) &&
851 g->critter_at( dest, true ) == nullptr ) {
852 try_to_move = true;
853 break;
854 }
855 }
856 }
857 // If true, don't try to greedily avoid locally bad paths
858 bool pathed = false;
859 if( try_to_move ) {
860 if( !wander() ) {
861 while( !path.empty() && path.front() == pos() ) {
862 path.erase( path.begin() );
863 }
864
865 const auto &pf_settings = get_pathfinding_settings();
866 if( pf_settings.max_dist >= rl_dist( pos(), goal ) &&
867 ( path.empty() || rl_dist( pos(), path.front() ) >= 2 || path.back() != goal ) ) {
868 // We need a new path
869 path = g->m.route( pos(), goal, pf_settings, get_path_avoid() );
870 }
871
872 // Try to respect old paths, even if we can't pathfind at the moment
873 if( !path.empty() && path.back() == goal ) {
874 destination = path.front();
875 moved = true;
876 pathed = true;
877 } else {
878 // Straight line forward, probably because we can't pathfind (well enough)
879 destination = goal;
880 moved = true;
881 }
882 }
883 }
884 if( !moved && has_flag( MF_SMELLS ) ) {
885 // No sight... or our plans are invalid (e.g. moving through a transparent, but
886 // solid, square of terrain). Fall back to smell if we have it.
887 unset_dest();
888 tripoint tmp = scent_move();
889 if( tmp.x != -1 ) {
890 destination = tmp;
891 moved = true;
892 }
893 }
894 if( wandf > 0 && !moved && friendly == 0 ) { // No LOS, no scent, so as a fall-back follow sound
895 unset_dest();
896 if( wander_pos != pos() ) {
897 destination = wander_pos;
898 moved = true;
899 }
900 }
901
902 if( !g->m.has_zlevels() ) {
903 // Otherwise weird things happen
904 destination.z = posz();
905 }
906
907 point new_d( destination.xy() - pos().xy() );
908
909 // toggle facing direction for sdl flip
910 if( !tile_iso ) {
911 if( new_d.x < 0 ) {
912 facing = FD_LEFT;
913 } else if( new_d.x > 0 ) {
914 facing = FD_RIGHT;
915 }
916 } else {
917 if( new_d.y <= 0 && new_d.x <= 0 ) {
918 facing = FD_LEFT;
919 }
920 if( new_d.x >= 0 && new_d.y >= 0 ) {
921 facing = FD_RIGHT;
922 }
923 }
924
925 tripoint next_step;
926 const bool can_open_doors = has_flag( MF_CAN_OPEN_DOORS );
927 const bool staggers = has_flag( MF_STUMBLES );
928 if( moved ) {
929 // Implement both avoiding obstacles and staggering.
930 moved = false;
931 float switch_chance = 0.0;
932 const bool can_bash = bash_skill() > 0;
933 // This is a float and using trig_dist() because that Does the Right Thing(tm)
934 // in both circular and roguelike distance modes.
935 const float distance_to_target = trig_dist( pos(), destination );
936 for( tripoint &candidate : squares_closer_to( pos(), destination ) ) {
937 bool via_ramp = false;
938 if( here.has_flag( TFLAG_RAMP_UP, candidate ) ) {
939 via_ramp = true;
940 candidate.z += 1;
941 } else if( here.has_flag( TFLAG_RAMP_DOWN, candidate ) ) {
942 via_ramp = true;
943 candidate.z -= 1;
944 }
945 tripoint candidate_abs = g->m.getabs( candidate );
946
947 if( candidate.z != posz() ) {
948 bool can_z_move = true;
949 if( !here.valid_move( pos(), candidate, false, true, via_ramp ) ) {
950 // Can't phase through floor
951 can_z_move = false;
952 }
953
954 // If we're trying to go up but can't fly, check if we can climb. If we can't, then don't
955 // This prevents non-climb/fly enemies running up walls
956 if( candidate.z > posz() && !( via_ramp || flies() ) ) {
957 if( !can_climb() || !here.has_floor_or_support( candidate ) ) {
958 // Can't "jump" up a whole z-level
959 can_z_move = false;
960 }
961 }
962
963 // Last chance - we can still do the z-level stair teleport bullshit that isn't removed yet
964 // TODO: Remove z-level stair bullshit teleport after aligning all stairs
965 if( !can_z_move &&
966 posx() / ( SEEX * 2 ) == candidate.x / ( SEEX * 2 ) &&
967 posy() / ( SEEY * 2 ) == candidate.y / ( SEEY * 2 ) ) {
968 const tripoint &upper = candidate.z > posz() ? candidate : pos();
969 const tripoint &lower = candidate.z > posz() ? pos() : candidate;
970 if( g->m.has_flag( TFLAG_GOES_DOWN, upper ) && g->m.has_flag( TFLAG_GOES_UP, lower ) ) {
971 can_z_move = true;
972 }
973 }
974
975 if( !can_z_move ) {
976 continue;
977 }
978 }
979
980 // A flag to allow non-stumbling critters to stumble when the most direct choice is bad.
981 bool bad_choice = false;
982
983 const Creature *target = g->critter_at( candidate, is_hallucination() );
984 if( target != nullptr ) {
985 const Creature::Attitude att = attitude_to( *target );
986 if( att == A_HOSTILE ) {
987 // When attacking an adjacent enemy, we're direct.
988 moved = true;
989 next_step = candidate_abs;
990 break;
991 } else if( att == A_FRIENDLY && ( target->is_player() || target->is_npc() ) ) {
992 continue; // Friendly firing the player or an NPC is illegal for gameplay reasons
993 } else if( !has_flag( MF_ATTACKMON ) && !has_flag( MF_PUSH_MON ) ) {
994 // Bail out if there's a non-hostile monster in the way and we're not pushy.
995 continue;
996 }
997 // Friendly fire and pushing are always bad choices - they take a lot of time
998 bad_choice = true;
999 }
1000
1001 map &here = g->m;
1002 // is there an openable door?
1003 if( can_open_doors &&
1004 here.open_door( candidate, !here.is_outside( pos() ), true ) ) {
1005 moved = true;
1006 next_step = candidate_abs;
1007 continue;
1008 }
1009
1010 // Try to shove vehicle out of the way
1011 shove_vehicle( destination, candidate );
1012 // Bail out if we can't move there and we can't bash.
1013 if( !pathed && ( !can_move_to( candidate ) || !can_squeeze_to( candidate ) ) ) {
1014 if( !can_bash ) {
1015 continue;
1016 }
1017 // Don't bash if we're just tracking a noise.
1018 if( wander() && destination == wander_pos ) {
1019 continue;
1020 }
1021 const int estimate = here.bash_rating( bash_estimate(), candidate );
1022 if( estimate <= 0 ) {
1023 continue;
1024 }
1025
1026 if( estimate < 5 ) {
1027 bad_choice = true;
1028 }
1029 }
1030
1031 const float progress = distance_to_target - trig_dist( candidate, destination );
1032 // The x2 makes the first (and most direct) path twice as likely,
1033 // since the chance of switching is 1/1, 1/4, 1/6, 1/8
1034 switch_chance += progress * 2;
1035 // Randomly pick one of the viable squares to move to weighted by distance.
1036 if( progress > 0 && ( !moved || x_in_y( progress, switch_chance ) ) ) {
1037 moved = true;
1038 next_step = candidate_abs;
1039 // If we stumble, pick a random square, otherwise take the first one,
1040 // which is the most direct path.
1041 // Except if the direct path is bad, then check others
1042 // Or if the path is given by pathfinder
1043 if( !staggers && ( !bad_choice || pathed ) ) {
1044 break;
1045 }
1046 }
1047 }
1048 }
1049 // Finished logic section. By this point, we should have chosen a square to
1050 // move to (moved = true).
1051 const tripoint local_next_step = g->m.getlocal( next_step );
1052 if( moved ) { // Actual effects of moving to the square we've chosen
1053 const bool did_something =
1054 ( !pacified && attack_at( local_next_step ) ) ||
1055 ( !pacified && can_open_doors && g->m.open_door( local_next_step, !g->m.is_outside( pos() ) ) ) ||
1056 ( !pacified && bash_at( local_next_step ) ) ||
1057 ( !pacified && push_to( local_next_step, 0, 0 ) ) ||
1058 move_to( local_next_step, false, false, get_stagger_adjust( pos(), destination, local_next_step ) );
1059
1060 if( !did_something ) {
1061 moves -= 100; // If we don't do this, we'll get infinite loops.
1062 }
1063 if( has_effect( effect_dragging ) && dragged_foe != nullptr ) {
1064
1065 if( !dragged_foe->has_effect( effect_grabbed ) ) {
1066 dragged_foe = nullptr;
1067 remove_effect( effect_dragging );
1068 } else if( g->m.getlocal( drag_to ) != pos() &&
1069 g->critter_at( g->m.getlocal( drag_to ) ) == nullptr ) {
1070 dragged_foe->setpos( g->m.getlocal( drag_to ) );
1071 }
1072 }
1073 } else {
1074 moves -= 100;
1075 stumble();
1076 path.clear();
1077 }
1078
1079 if( has_effect( effect_led_by_leash ) ) {
1080 if( rl_dist( pos(), g->u.pos() ) > 8 ) {
1081 // Either failed to keep up with the player or moved away
1082 remove_effect( effect_led_by_leash );
1083 add_msg( m_info, _( "You lose hold of a leash." ) );
1084 }
1085 }
1086}

References _, Creature::A_FRIENDLY, Creature::A_HOSTILE, action, behavior::tree::add(), add_msg(), attack_at(), attitude(), attitude_to(), bash_at(), bash_estimate(), map::bash_rating(), bash_skill(), can_climb(), can_move_to(), can_squeeze_to(), mon_special_attack::cooldown, die(), die_if_drowning(), effect_ai_waiting, effect_dragging, effect_grabbed, effect_harnessed, effect_led_by_leash, effect_pacified, effect_stunned, mon_special_attack::enabled, Creature::facing, FD_LEFT, FD_RIGHT, find_dragged_foe(), flies(), friendly, g, mtype::get_goals(), get_map(), get_path_avoid(), get_pathfinding_settings(), get_stagger_adjust(), goal, Creature::has_effect(), map::has_flag(), has_flag(), map::has_floor_or_support(), hp, mtype::hp, mtype::id, is_dead(), is_hallucination(), Creature::is_npc(), map::is_outside(), Creature::is_player(), m_info, MATT_FOLLOW, MATT_IGNORE, MF_ABSORBS_SPLITS, MF_ATTACKMON, MF_CAN_OPEN_DOORS, MF_IMMOBILE, MF_PUSH_MON, MF_RIDEABLE_MECH, MF_SMELLS, MF_STUMBLES, MONSTER_FOLLOW_DIST, move_effects(), move_to(), Creature::moves, name(), nursebot_operate(), one_in(), map::open_door(), path, pos(), posx(), posy(), posz(), push_to(), Creature::remove_effect(), reset_special(), rl_dist(), scent_move(), SEEX, SEEY, Character::setpos(), shove_vehicle(), spawn(), special_attacks, mtype::special_attacks, squares_closer_to(), stumble(), TFLAG_GOES_DOWN, TFLAG_GOES_UP, TFLAG_NO_FLOOR, TFLAG_RAMP_DOWN, TFLAG_RAMP_UP, behavior::tree::tick(), tile_iso, trig_dist(), type, unset_dest(), map::valid_move(), wander(), wander_pos, wandf, point::x, tripoint::x, x_in_y(), tripoint::xy(), point::y, and tripoint::z.

◆ move_effects()

bool monster::move_effects ( bool  attacking)
overridevirtual

Processes effects which may prevent the monster from moving (bear traps, crushed, etc.).

Returns false if movement is stopped.

Implements Creature.

Definition at line 1685 of file monster.cpp.

1686{
1687 // This function is relatively expensive, we want that cached
1688 // IMPORTANT: If adding any new effects here, make SURE to
1689 // add them to hardcoded_movement_impairing in effect.cpp
1690 if( !effect_cache[MOVEMENT_IMPAIRED] ) {
1691 return true;
1692 }
1693
1694 bool u_see_me = g->u.sees( *this );
1695 if( has_effect( effect_tied ) ) {
1696 // friendly pet, will stay tied down and obey.
1697 if( friendly == -1 ) {
1698 return false;
1699 }
1700 // non-friendly monster will struggle to get free occasionally.
1701 // some monsters can't be tangled up with a net/bolas/lasso etc.
1702 bool immediate_break = type->in_species( FISH ) || type->in_species( MOLLUSK ) ||
1703 type->in_species( ROBOT ) || type->bodytype == "snake" || type->bodytype == "blob";
1704 if( !immediate_break && rng( 0, 900 ) > type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides * 1.5 ) {
1705 if( u_see_me ) {
1706 add_msg( _( "The %s struggles to break free of its bonds." ), name() );
1707 }
1708 } else if( immediate_break ) {
1709 remove_effect( effect_tied );
1710 if( tied_item ) {
1711 if( u_see_me ) {
1712 add_msg( _( "The %s easily slips out of its bonds." ), name() );
1713 }
1714 g->m.add_item_or_charges( pos(), *tied_item );
1715 tied_item.reset();
1716 }
1717 } else {
1718 if( tied_item ) {
1719 const bool broken = rng( type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides, std::min( 10000,
1720 type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides * 250 ) ) > 800;
1721 if( !broken ) {
1722 g->m.add_item_or_charges( pos(), *tied_item );
1723 }
1724 tied_item.reset();
1725 if( u_see_me ) {
1726 if( broken ) {
1727 add_msg( _( "The %s snaps the bindings holding it down." ), name() );
1728 } else {
1729 add_msg( _( "The %s breaks free of the bindings holding it down." ), name() );
1730 }
1731 }
1732 }
1733 remove_effect( effect_tied );
1734 }
1735 return false;
1736 }
1737 if( has_effect( effect_downed ) ) {
1738 if( rng( 0, 40 ) > type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides * 1.5 ) {
1739 if( u_see_me ) {
1740 add_msg( _( "The %s struggles to stand." ), name() );
1741 }
1742 } else {
1743 if( u_see_me ) {
1744 add_msg( _( "The %s climbs to its feet!" ), name() );
1745 }
1746 remove_effect( effect_downed );
1747 }
1748 return false;
1749 }
1750 if( has_effect( effect_webbed ) ) {
1751 if( x_in_y( type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides, 6 * get_effect_int( effect_webbed ) ) ) {
1752 if( u_see_me ) {
1753 add_msg( _( "The %s breaks free of the webs!" ), name() );
1754 }
1755 remove_effect( effect_webbed );
1756 }
1757 return false;
1758 }
1759 if( has_effect( effect_lightsnare ) ) {
1760 if( x_in_y( type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides, 12 ) ) {
1761 remove_effect( effect_lightsnare );
1762 g->m.spawn_item( pos(), "string_36" );
1763 g->m.spawn_item( pos(), "snare_trigger" );
1764 if( u_see_me ) {
1765 add_msg( _( "The %s escapes the light snare!" ), name() );
1766 }
1767 }
1768 return false;
1769 }
1770 if( has_effect( effect_heavysnare ) ) {
1771 if( type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides >= 7 ) {
1772 if( x_in_y( type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides, 32 ) ) {
1773 remove_effect( effect_heavysnare );
1774 g->m.spawn_item( pos(), "rope_6" );
1775 g->m.spawn_item( pos(), "snare_trigger" );
1776 if( u_see_me ) {
1777 add_msg( _( "The %s escapes the heavy snare!" ), name() );
1778 }
1779 }
1780 }
1781 return false;
1782 }
1783 if( has_effect( effect_beartrap ) ) {
1784 if( type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides >= 18 ) {
1785 if( x_in_y( type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides, 200 ) ) {
1786 remove_effect( effect_beartrap );
1787 g->m.spawn_item( pos(), "beartrap" );
1788 if( u_see_me ) {
1789 add_msg( _( "The %s escapes the bear trap!" ), name() );
1790 }
1791 }
1792 }
1793 return false;
1794 }
1795 if( has_effect( effect_crushed ) ) {
1796 if( x_in_y( type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides, 100 ) ) {
1797 remove_effect( effect_crushed );
1798 if( u_see_me ) {
1799 add_msg( _( "The %s frees itself from the rubble!" ), name() );
1800 }
1801 }
1802 return false;
1803 }
1804
1805 // If we ever get more effects that force movement on success this will need to be reworked to
1806 // only trigger success effects if /all/ rolls succeed
1807 if( has_effect( effect_in_pit ) ) {
1808 if( rng( 0, 40 ) > type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides ) {
1809 return false;
1810 } else {
1811 if( u_see_me ) {
1812 add_msg( _( "The %s escapes the pit!" ), name() );
1813 }
1814 remove_effect( effect_in_pit );
1815 }
1816 }
1817 if( has_effect( effect_grabbed ) ) {
1818 if( dice( type->melee_dice + type->melee_sides, 3 ) < get_effect_int( effect_grabbed ) ||
1819 !one_in( 4 ) ) {
1820 return false;
1821 } else {
1822 if( u_see_me ) {
1823 add_msg( _( "The %s breaks free from the grab!" ), name() );
1824 }
1825 remove_effect( effect_grabbed );
1826 }
1827 }
1828 return true;
1829}

◆ move_to()

bool monster::move_to ( const tripoint &  p,
bool  force = false,
bool  step_on_critter = false,
float  stagger_adjustment = 1.0 
)

Attempt to move to p.

If there's something blocking the movement, such as infinite move costs at the target, an existing NPC or monster, this function simply aborts and does nothing.

Parameters
pDestination of movement
forceIf this is set to true, the movement will happen even if there's currently something, else than a creature, blocking the destination.
step_on_critterIf this is set to true, the movement will happen even if there's currently a creature blocking the destination.
stagger_adjustmentis a multiplier for move cost to compensate for staggering.
Returns
true if movement successful, false otherwise

Definition at line 1548 of file monmove.cpp.

1550{
1551 const bool on_ground = !digging() && !flies();
1552
1553 const bool z_move = p.z != pos().z;
1554 const bool going_up = p.z > pos().z;
1555
1556 tripoint destination = p;
1557
1558 // This is stair teleportation hackery.
1559 // TODO: Remove this in favor of stair alignment
1560 if( going_up ) {
1561 if( g->m.has_flag( TFLAG_GOES_UP, pos() ) ) {
1562 destination = find_closest_stair( p, TFLAG_GOES_DOWN );
1563 }
1564 } else if( z_move ) {
1565 if( g->m.has_flag( TFLAG_GOES_DOWN, pos() ) ) {
1566 destination = find_closest_stair( p, TFLAG_GOES_UP );
1567 }
1568 }
1569
1570 // Allows climbing monsters to move on terrain with movecost <= 0
1571 Creature *critter = g->critter_at( destination, is_hallucination() );
1572 if( g->m.has_flag( "CLIMBABLE", destination ) ) {
1573 if( g->m.impassable( destination ) && critter == nullptr ) {
1574 if( flies() ) {
1575 moves -= 100;
1576 force = true;
1577 if( g->u.sees( *this ) ) {
1578 add_msg( _( "The %1$s flies over the %2$s." ), name(),
1579 g->m.has_flag_furn( "CLIMBABLE", p ) ? g->m.furnname( p ) :
1580 g->m.tername( p ) );
1581 }
1582 } else if( climbs() ) {
1583 moves -= 150;
1584 force = true;
1585 if( g->u.sees( *this ) ) {
1586 add_msg( _( "The %1$s climbs over the %2$s." ), name(),
1587 g->m.has_flag_furn( "CLIMBABLE", p ) ? g->m.furnname( p ) :
1588 g->m.tername( p ) );
1589 }
1590 }
1591 }
1592 }
1593
1594 if( critter != nullptr && !step_on_critter ) {
1595 return false;
1596 }
1597
1598 if( !can_squeeze_to( destination ) ) {
1599 return false;
1600 }
1601
1602 // Make sure that we can move there, unless force is true.
1603 if( !force && !can_move_to( destination ) ) {
1604 return false;
1605 }
1606
1607 if( !force ) {
1608 // This adjustment is to make it so that monster movement speed relative to the player
1609 // is consistent even if the monster stumbles,
1610 // and the same regardless of the distance measurement mode.
1611 // Note: Keep this as float here or else it will cancel valid moves
1612 const float cost = stagger_adjustment *
1613 static_cast<float>( climbs() &&
1614 g->m.has_flag( TFLAG_NO_FLOOR, p ) ? calc_climb_cost( pos(), destination ) : calc_movecost( pos(),
1615 destination ) );
1616 if( cost > 0.0f ) {
1617 moves -= static_cast<int>( std::ceil( cost ) );
1618 } else {
1619 return false;
1620 }
1621 }
1622
1623 //Check for moving into/out of water
1624 bool was_water = g->m.is_divable( pos() );
1625 bool will_be_water = on_ground && can_submerge() && g->m.is_divable( destination );
1626
1627 // Attitude check is kinda slow, better gate it
1628 if( was_water != will_be_water && !flies() ) {
1629 if( attitude( &g->u ) != MATT_ATTACK ) {
1630 // Nothing, no need to spam
1631 } else if( was_water && !will_be_water && g->u.sees( p ) ) {
1632 // Use more dramatic messages for swimming monsters
1633 //~ Message when a monster emerges from water
1634 //~ %1$s: monster name, %2$s: leaps/emerges, %3$s: terrain name
1635 add_msg( m_warning, pgettext( "monster movement", "A %1$s %2$s from the %3$s!" ), name(),
1636 swims() || has_flag( MF_AQUATIC ) ? _( "leaps" ) : _( "emerges" ),
1637 g->m.tername( pos() ) );
1638 } else if( !was_water && will_be_water && g->u.sees( destination ) ) {
1639 //~ Message when a monster enters water
1640 //~ %1$s: monster name, %2$s: dives/sinks, %3$s: terrain name
1641 add_msg( m_warning, pgettext( "monster movement", "A %1$s %2$s into the %3$s!" ), name(),
1642 swims() || has_flag( MF_AQUATIC ) ? _( "dives" ) : _( "sinks" ),
1643 g->m.tername( destination ) );
1644 }
1645 }
1646
1647 setpos( destination );
1648 footsteps( destination );
1649 set_underwater( will_be_water );
1650 if( is_hallucination() ) {
1651 //Hallucinations don't do any of the stuff after this point
1652 return true;
1653 }
1654
1655 if( type->size != MS_TINY && on_ground ) {
1656 const int sharp_damage = rng( 1, 10 );
1657 const int rough_damage = rng( 1, 2 );
1658 if( g->m.has_flag( "SHARP", pos() ) && !one_in( 4 ) &&
1659 get_armor_cut( bodypart_id( "torso" ) ) < sharp_damage ) {
1660 apply_damage( nullptr, bodypart_id( "torso" ), sharp_damage );
1661 }
1662 if( g->m.has_flag( "ROUGH", pos() ) && one_in( 6 ) &&
1663 get_armor_cut( bodypart_id( "torso" ) ) < rough_damage ) {
1664 apply_damage( nullptr, bodypart_id( "torso" ), rough_damage );
1665 }
1666 }
1667
1668 if( g->m.has_flag( "UNSTABLE", destination ) && on_ground ) {
1669 add_effect( effect_bouldering, 1_turns, num_bp );
1670 } else if( has_effect( effect_bouldering ) ) {
1671 remove_effect( effect_bouldering );
1672 }
1673
1674 if( g->m.has_flag_ter_or_furn( TFLAG_NO_SIGHT, destination ) && on_ground ) {
1675 add_effect( effect_no_sight, 1_turns, num_bp );
1676 } else if( has_effect( effect_no_sight ) ) {
1677 remove_effect( effect_no_sight );
1678 }
1679
1680 g->m.creature_on_trap( *this );
1681 if( is_dead() ) {
1682 return true;
1683 }
1684 if( !will_be_water && ( digs() || can_dig() ) ) {
1685 set_underwater( g->m.has_flag( "DIGGABLE", pos() ) );
1686 }
1687 // Diggers turn the dirt into dirtmound
1688 if( digging() && g->m.has_flag( "DIGGABLE", pos() ) ) {
1689 int factor = 0;
1690 switch( type->size ) {
1691 case MS_TINY:
1692 factor = 100;
1693 break;
1694 case MS_SMALL:
1695 factor = 30;
1696 break;
1697 case MS_MEDIUM:
1698 factor = 6;
1699 break;
1700 case MS_LARGE:
1701 factor = 3;
1702 break;
1703 case MS_HUGE:
1704 factor = 1;
1705 break;
1706 default:
1707 factor = 6;
1708 break;
1709 }
1710 // TODO: make this take terrain type into account so diggers traveling under sand will create mounds of sand etc.
1711 if( one_in( factor ) ) {
1712 g->m.ter_set( pos(), t_dirtmound );
1713 }
1714 }
1715 // Acid trail monsters leave... a trail of acid
1716 if( has_flag( MF_ACIDTRAIL ) ) {
1717 g->m.add_field( pos(), fd_acid, 3 );
1718 }
1719
1720 // Not all acid trail monsters leave as much acid. Every time this monster takes a step, there is a 1/5 chance it will drop a puddle.
1721 if( has_flag( MF_SHORTACIDTRAIL ) ) {
1722 if( one_in( 5 ) ) {
1723 g->m.add_field( pos(), fd_acid, 3 );
1724 }
1725 }
1726
1727 if( has_flag( MF_SLUDGETRAIL ) ) {
1728 for( const tripoint &sludge_p : g->m.points_in_radius( pos(), 1 ) ) {
1729 const int fstr = 3 - ( std::abs( sludge_p.x - posx() ) + std::abs( sludge_p.y - posy() ) );
1730 if( fstr >= 2 ) {
1731 g->m.add_field( sludge_p, fd_sludge, fstr );
1732 }
1733 }
1734 }
1735
1736 if( has_flag( MF_DRIPS_NAPALM ) ) {
1737 if( one_in( 10 ) ) {
1738 // if it has more napalm, drop some and reduce ammo in tank
1739 if( ammo[itype_pressurized_tank] > 0 ) {
1740 g->m.add_item_or_charges( pos(), item( "napalm", calendar::turn, 50 ) );
1741 ammo[itype_pressurized_tank] -= 50;
1742 } else {
1743 // TODO: remove MF_DRIPS_NAPALM flag since no more napalm in tank
1744 // Not possible for now since flag check is done on type, not individual monster
1745 }
1746 }
1747 }
1748 if( has_flag( MF_DRIPS_GASOLINE ) ) {
1749 if( one_in( 5 ) ) {
1750 // TODO: use same idea that limits napalm dripping
1751 g->m.add_item_or_charges( pos(), item( "gasoline" ) );
1752 }
1753 }
1754 return true;

507{
508 std::string ret;

513 } else if( made_of( material_id( "bone" ) ) ) {
514 ret = _( "exoskeleton" );
515 } else if( made_of( material_id( "flesh" ) ) || made_of( material_id( "hflesh" ) ) ||
516 made_of( material_id( "iflesh" ) ) ) {
517 ret = _( "thick hide" );
518 } else if( made_of( material_id( "iron" ) ) || made_of( material_id( "steel" ) ) ) {
519 ret = _( "armor plating" );
520 } else if( made_of( LIQUID ) ) {
521 ret = _( "dense jelly mass" );
522 } else {
523 ret = _( "armor" );
524 }
525 if( has_effect( effect_monster_armor ) && !inv.empty() ) {
526 for( const item &armor : inv ) {
527 if( armor.is_pet_armor( true ) ) {
528 ret += string_format( _( "wearing %1$s" ), armor.tname( 1 ) );
529 break;
530 }
531 }
532 }
533
534 return ret;
535}

References _, effect_monster_armor, Creature::has_effect(), mtype::in_species(), INSECT, inv, LIQUID, made_of(), cata::hash64_detail::ret, string_format(), and type.

Referenced by skin_name().

313{
314 if( type->age_grow > 0 ) {
315 return type->age_grow;

317 const int scaled_half_life = type->half_life * get_option<float>( "MONSTER_UPGRADE_FACTOR" );
318 int day = 1; // 1 day of guaranteed evolve time
319 for( int i = 0; i < UPGRADE_MAX_ITERS; i++ ) {
320 if( one_in( 2 ) ) {
321 day += rng( 0, scaled_half_life );
322 return day;
323 } else {
324 day += scaled_half_life;
325 }

328 upgrades = false;

◆ normalize_ammo()

void monster::normalize_ammo ( int  old_ammo)
private

Legacy loading logic for monsters that are packing ammo.

Definition at line 2119 of file monster.cpp.

2120{
2121 int total_ammo = 0;
2122 // Sum up the ammo entries to get a ratio.
2123 for( const auto &ammo_entry : type->starting_ammo ) {
2124 total_ammo += ammo_entry.second;
2125 }
2126 if( total_ammo == 0 ) {
2127 // Should never happen, but protect us from a div/0 if it does.
2128 return;
2129 }
2130 // Previous code gave robots 100 rounds of ammo.
2131 // This reassigns whatever is left from that in the appropriate proportions.
2132 for( const auto &ammo_entry : type->starting_ammo ) {
2133 ammo[ammo_entry.first] = old_ammo * ammo_entry.second / ( 100 * total_ammo );
2134 }
2135}

◆ on_load()

void monster::on_load ( )

Retroactively update monster.

Call this after a preexisting monster has been placed on map. Don't call for monsters that have been freshly created, it may cause the monster to upgrade itself into another monster type.

Definition at line 3004 of file monster.cpp.

3005{
3006 try_upgrade( false );
3007 try_reproduce();
3008 if( has_flag( MF_MILKABLE ) ) {
3009 refill_udders();
3010 }
3011
3012 const time_duration dt = calendar::turn - last_updated;
3013 last_updated = calendar::turn;
3014 if( dt <= 0_turns ) {
3015 return;
3016 }
3017 float regen = type->regenerates;
3018 if( regen <= 0 ) {
3019 if( has_flag( MF_REVIVES ) ) {
3020 regen = 1.0f / to_turns<int>( 1_hours );
3021 } else if( made_of( material_id( "flesh" ) ) || made_of( material_id( "veggy" ) ) ) {
3022 // Most living stuff here
3023 regen = 0.25f / to_turns<int>( 1_hours );
3024 }
3025 }
3026 const int heal_amount = roll_remainder( regen * to_turns<int>( dt ) );
3027 const int healed = heal( heal_amount );
3028 int healed_speed = 0;
3029 if( healed < heal_amount && get_speed_base() < type->speed ) {
3030 int old_speed = get_speed_base();
3031 set_speed_base( std::min( get_speed_base() + heal_amount - healed, type->speed ) );
3032 healed_speed = get_speed_base() - old_speed;
3033 }
3034
3035 add_msg( m_debug, "on_load() by %s, %d turns, healed %d hp, %d speed",
3036 name(), to_turns<int>( dt ), healed, healed_speed );

◆ plan()

void monster::plan ( )

Definition at line 316 of file monmove.cpp.

317{
318 const auto &factions = g->critter_tracker->factions();
319
320 // Bots are more intelligent than most living stuff
321 bool smart_planning = has_flag( MF_PRIORITIZE_TARGETS );
322 Creature *target = nullptr;
323 int max_sight_range = std::max( type->vision_day, type->vision_night );
324 // 8.6f is rating for tank drone 60 tiles away, moose 16 or boomer 33
325 float dist = !smart_planning ? max_sight_range : 8.6f;
326 bool fleeing = false;
327 bool docile = friendly != 0 && has_effect( effect_docile );
328 bool waiting = has_effect( effect_ai_waiting );
329
330 const bool angers_hostile_weak = type->has_anger_trigger( mon_trigger::HOSTILE_WEAK );
331 const int angers_hostile_near = type->has_anger_trigger( mon_trigger::HOSTILE_CLOSE ) ? 5 : 0;
332 const int angers_mating_season = type->has_anger_trigger( mon_trigger::MATING_SEASON ) ? 3 : 0;
333 const int angers_cub_threatened = type->has_anger_trigger( mon_trigger::PLAYER_NEAR_BABY ) ? 8 : 0;
334 const int fears_hostile_near = type->has_fear_trigger( mon_trigger::HOSTILE_CLOSE ) ? 5 : 0;
335
336 bool group_morale = has_flag( MF_GROUP_MORALE ) && morale < type->morale;
337 bool swarms = has_flag( MF_SWARMS );
338 auto mood = attitude();
339
340 // If we can see the player, move toward them or flee, simpleminded animals are too dumb to follow the player.
341 if( friendly == 0 && sees( g->u ) && !waiting ) {
342 dist = rate_target( g->u, dist, smart_planning );
343 fleeing = fleeing || is_fleeing( g->u );
344 target = &g->u;
345 if( dist <= 5 ) {
346 anger += angers_hostile_near;
347 morale -= fears_hostile_near;
348 if( angers_mating_season > 0 ) {
349 bool mating_angry = false;
350 season_type season = season_of_year( calendar::turn );
351 for( auto &elem : type->baby_flags ) {
352 if( ( season == SUMMER && elem == "SUMMER" ) ||
353 ( season == WINTER && elem == "WINTER" ) ||
354 ( season == SPRING && elem == "SPRING" ) ||
355 ( season == AUTUMN && elem == "AUTUMN" ) ) {
356 mating_angry = true;
357 break;
358 }
359 }
360 if( mating_angry ) {
361 anger += angers_mating_season;
362 }
363 }
364 }
365 if( angers_cub_threatened > 0 ) {
366 for( monster &tmp : g->all_monsters() ) {
367 if( type->baby_monster == tmp.type->id ) {
368 // baby nearby; is the player too close?
369 dist = tmp.rate_target( g->u, dist, smart_planning );
370 if( dist <= 3 ) {
371 //proximity to baby; monster gets furious and less likely to flee
372 anger += angers_cub_threatened;
373 morale += angers_cub_threatened / 2;
374 }
375 }
376 }
377 }
378 } else if( friendly != 0 && !docile && !waiting ) {
379 for( monster &tmp : g->all_monsters() ) {
380 if( tmp.friendly == 0 ) {
381 float rating = rate_target( tmp, dist, smart_planning );
382 if( rating < dist ) {
383 target = &tmp;
384 dist = rating;
385 }
386 }
387 }
388 }
389
390 if( waiting ) {
391 set_dest( pos() );
392 return;
393 }
394
395 if( docile ) {
396 if( friendly != 0 && target != nullptr ) {
397 set_dest( target->pos() );
398 }
399
400 return;
401 }
402
403 int valid_targets = ( target == nullptr ) ? 1 : 0;
404 for( npc &who : g->all_npcs() ) {
405 auto faction_att = faction.obj().attitude( who.get_monster_faction() );
406 if( faction_att == MFA_NEUTRAL || faction_att == MFA_FRIENDLY ) {
407 continue;
408 }
409
410 float rating = rate_target( who, dist, smart_planning );
411 bool fleeing_from = is_fleeing( who );
412 if( rating == dist && ( fleeing || attitude( &who ) == MATT_ATTACK ) ) {
413 ++valid_targets;
414 if( one_in( valid_targets ) ) {
415 target = &who;
416 }
417 }
418 // Switch targets if closer and hostile or scarier than current target
419 if( ( rating < dist && fleeing ) ||
420 ( faction_att == MFA_HATE ) ||
421 ( rating < dist && attitude( &who ) == MATT_ATTACK ) ||
422 ( !fleeing && fleeing_from ) ) {
423 target = &who;
424 dist = rating;
425 valid_targets = 1;
426 }
427 fleeing = fleeing || fleeing_from;
428 if( rating <= 5 ) {
429 anger += angers_hostile_near;
430 morale -= fears_hostile_near;
431 if( angers_mating_season > 0 ) {
432 bool mating_angry = false;
433 season_type season = season_of_year( calendar::turn );
434 for( auto &elem : type->baby_flags ) {
435 if( ( season == SUMMER && elem == "SUMMER" ) ||
436 ( season == WINTER && elem == "WINTER" ) ||
437 ( season == SPRING && elem == "SPRING" ) ||
438 ( season == AUTUMN && elem == "AUTUMN" ) ) {
439 mating_angry = true;
440 break;
441 }
442 }
443 if( mating_angry ) {
444 anger += angers_mating_season;
445 }
446 }
447 }
448 }
449
450 fleeing = fleeing || ( mood == MATT_FLEE );
451 if( friendly == 0 ) {
452 for( const auto &fac : factions ) {
453 auto faction_att = faction.obj().attitude( fac.first );
454 if( faction_att == MFA_NEUTRAL || faction_att == MFA_FRIENDLY ) {
455 continue;
456 }
457
458 for( const weak_ptr_fast<monster> &weak : fac.second ) {
459 const shared_ptr_fast<monster> shared = weak.lock();
460 if( !shared ) {
461 continue;
462 }
463 monster &mon = *shared;
464 float rating = rate_target( mon, dist, smart_planning );
465 if( rating == dist ) {
466 ++valid_targets;
467 if( one_in( valid_targets ) ) {
468 target = &mon;
469 }
470 }
471 if( rating < dist ) {
472 target = &mon;
473 dist = rating;
474 valid_targets = 1;
475 }
476 if( rating <= 5 ) {
477 anger += angers_hostile_near;
478 morale -= fears_hostile_near;
479 }
480 }
481 }
482 }
483
484 // Friendly monsters here
485 // Avoid for hordes of same-faction stuff or it could get expensive
486 const auto actual_faction = friendly == 0 ? faction : mfaction_str_id( "player" );
487 const auto &myfaction_iter = factions.find( actual_faction );
488 if( myfaction_iter == factions.end() ) {
489 DebugLog( DL::Error, DC::Game ) << disp_name() << " tried to find faction "
490 << actual_faction.id().str()
491 << " which wasn't loaded in game::monmove";
492 swarms = false;
493 group_morale = false;
494 }
495 swarms = swarms && target == nullptr; // Only swarm if we have no target
496 if( group_morale || swarms ) {
497 for( const weak_ptr_fast<monster> &weak : myfaction_iter->second ) {
498 const shared_ptr_fast<monster> shared = weak.lock();
499 if( !shared ) {
500 continue;
501 }
502 monster &mon = *shared;
503 float rating = rate_target( mon, dist, smart_planning );
504 if( group_morale && rating <= 10 ) {
505 morale += 10 - rating;
506 }
507 if( swarms ) {
508 if( rating < 5 ) { // Too crowded here
509 wander_pos.x = posx() * rng( 1, 3 ) - mon.posx();
510 wander_pos.y = posy() * rng( 1, 3 ) - mon.posy();
511 wandf = 2;
512 target = nullptr;
513 // Swarm to the furthest ally you can see
514 } else if( rating < FLT_MAX && rating > dist && wandf <= 0 ) {
515 target = &mon;
516 dist = rating;
517 }
518 }
519 }
520 }
521
522 // Operating monster keep you safe while they operate, how nice....
523 if( type->has_special_attack( "OPERATE" ) ) {
524 int prev_friendlyness = friendly;
525 if( has_effect( effect_operating ) ) {
526 friendly = 100;
527 for( auto critter : g->m.get_creatures_in_radius( pos(), 6 ) ) {
528 monster *mon = dynamic_cast<monster *>( critter );
529 if( mon != nullptr && mon->type->in_species( ZOMBIE ) ) {
530 anger = 100;
531 } else {
532 anger = 0;
533 }
534 }
535 } else {
536 friendly = prev_friendlyness;
537 }
538 }
539
540 if( has_effect( effect_dragging ) ) {
541
542 if( type->has_special_attack( "OPERATE" ) ) {
543
544 bool found_path_to_couch = false;
545 tripoint tmp( pos() + point( 12, 12 ) );
546 tripoint couch_loc;
547 for( const auto &couch_pos : g->m.find_furnitures_or_vparts_with_flag_in_radius( pos(), 10,
548 flag_AUTODOC_COUCH ) ) {
549 if( g->m.clear_path( pos(), couch_pos, 10, 0, 100 ) ) {
550 if( rl_dist( pos(), couch_pos ) < rl_dist( pos(), tmp ) ) {
551 tmp = couch_pos;
552 found_path_to_couch = true;
553 couch_loc = couch_pos;
554 }
555 }
556 }
557
558 if( !found_path_to_couch ) {
559 anger = 0;
560 remove_effect( effect_dragging );
561 } else {
562 set_dest( couch_loc );
563 }
564 }
565
566 } else if( target != nullptr ) {
567
568 tripoint dest = target->pos();
569 auto att_to_target = attitude_to( *target );
570 if( att_to_target == Attitude::A_HOSTILE && !fleeing ) {
571 set_dest( dest );
572 } else if( fleeing ) {
573 set_dest( tripoint( posx() * 2 - dest.x, posy() * 2 - dest.y, posz() ) );
574 }
575 if( angers_hostile_weak && att_to_target != Attitude::A_FRIENDLY ) {
576 int hp_per = target->hp_percentage();
577 if( hp_per <= 70 ) {
578 anger += 10 - static_cast<int>( hp_per / 10 );
579 }
580 }
581 } else if( friendly > 0 && one_in( 3 ) ) {
582 // Grow restless with no targets
583 friendly--;
584 // if no target, and friendly pet sees the player
585 } else if( friendly < 0 && sees( g->u ) ) {
586 // eg dogs
587 if( !has_flag( MF_PET_WONT_FOLLOW ) ) {
588 // if too far from the player, go to him
589 if( rl_dist( pos(), g->u.pos() ) > 2 ) {
590 set_dest( g->u.pos() );
591 } else {
592 unset_dest();
593 }
594 // eg cows, horses
595 } else {
596 unset_dest();
597 }
598 // when the players is close to their pet, it calms them
599 // it helps them reach an homeostatic state, for morale and anger
600 const int distance_from_friend = rl_dist( pos(), get_avatar().pos() );
601 if( distance_from_friend < 12 ) {
602 if( one_in( distance_from_friend * 3 ) ) {
603 if( morale != type->morale ) {
604 morale += ( morale < type->morale ) ? 1 : -1;
605 }
606 if( anger != type->agro ) {
607 anger += ( anger < type->agro ) ? 1 : -1;
608 }
609 }
610 }
611 }
612
613 // being led by a leash override other movements decisions
614 if( has_effect( effect_led_by_leash ) && friendly != 0 ) {
615 // if we have an hostile target adjacent to the payer, and we're not fleeing, we can potentially attack it
616 if( target != nullptr && rl_dist( g->u.pos(), target->pos() ) < 2 &&
617 target->attitude_to( g->u ) == Attitude::A_HOSTILE && !fleeing ) {
618 // if we're too far from the player, go back to it
619 if( rl_dist( pos(), g->u.pos() ) > 5 ) {
620 set_dest( g->u.pos() );
621 }
622 } else if( rl_dist( pos(), g->u.pos() ) > 1 ) {
623 set_dest( g->u.pos() );
624 } else {
625 unset_dest();
626 }
627 }
628}

◆ print_info()

int monster::print_info ( const catacurses::window &  w,
int  vStart,
int  vLines,
int  column 
) const
overridevirtual

Write information about this creature.

Parameters
wthe window to print the text into.
vStartvertical start to print, that means the first line to print.
vLinesnumber of lines to print at most (printing less is fine).
columnhorizontal start to print (column), horizontal end is one character before the right border of the window (to keep the border).
Returns
The line just behind the last printed line, that means multiple calls to this can be stacked, the return value is acceptable as vStart for the next call without creating empty lines or overwriting lines.

Implements Creature.
