2535{
2536 // Monster only effects
2537 for( auto &elem : *effects ) {
2538 for( auto &_effect_it : elem.second ) {
2539 if( !_effect_it.second.is_removed() ) {
2540 process_one_effect( _effect_it.second, false );
2541 }
2542 }
2543 }
2544
2545 // Like with player/NPCs - keep the speed above 0
2546 const int min_speed_bonus = -0.75 * get_speed_base();
2547 if( get_speed_bonus() < min_speed_bonus ) {
2548 set_speed_bonus( min_speed_bonus );
2549 }
2550
2551 //If this monster has the ability to heal in combat, do it now.
2552 int regeneration_amount = type->regenerates;
2553 float regen_multiplier = 0;
2554 //Apply effect-triggered regeneration modifiers
2555 for( const auto &regeneration_modifier : type->regeneration_modifiers ) {
2556 if( has_effect( regeneration_modifier.first ) ) {
2557 effect &e = get_effect( regeneration_modifier.first );
2558 regen_multiplier = 1.00 + regeneration_modifier.second.base_modifier +
2559 ( e.get_intensity() - 1 ) * regeneration_modifier.second.scale_modifier;
2560 regeneration_amount = round( regeneration_amount * regen_multiplier );
2561 }
2562 }
2563 //Prevent negative regeneration
2564 if( regeneration_amount < 0 ) {
2565 regeneration_amount = 0;
2566 }
2567 const int healed_amount = heal( round( regeneration_amount ) );
2568 if( healed_amount > 0 && one_in( 2 ) && g->u.sees( *this ) ) {
2569 add_msg( m_debug, ( "Regen: %s" ), healed_amount );
2570 std::string healing_format_string;
2571 if( healed_amount >= 50 ) {
2572 healing_format_string = _( "The %s is visibly regenerating!" );
2573 } else if( healed_amount >= 10 ) {
2574 healing_format_string = _( "The %s seems a little healthier." );
2575 } else {
2576 healing_format_string = _( "The %s is healing slowly." );
2577 }
2578 add_msg( m_warning, healing_format_string, name() );
2579 }
2580
2581 if( type->regenerates_in_dark ) {
2582 const float light = g->m.ambient_light_at( pos() );
2583 // Magic number 10000 was chosen so that a floodlight prevents regeneration in a range of 20 tiles
2584 if( heal( static_cast<int>( 50.0 * std::exp( - light * light / 10000 ) ) > 0 && one_in( 2 ) &&
2585 g->u.sees( *this ) ) ) {
2586 add_msg( m_warning, _( "The %s uses the darkness to regenerate." ), name() );
2587 }
2588 }
2589
2590 // Monster will regen morale and aggression if it is on max HP
2591 // It regens more morale and aggression if is currently fleeing.
2592 if( type->regen_morale && hp >= type->hp ) {
2593 if( is_fleeing( g->u ) ) {
2594 morale = type->morale;
2595 anger = type->agro;
2596 }
2597 if( morale <= type->morale ) {
2598 morale += 1;
2599 }
2600 if( anger <= type->agro ) {
2601 anger += 1;
2602 }
2603 if( morale < 0 ) {
2604 morale += 5;
2605 }
2606 if( anger < 0 ) {
2607 anger += 5;
2608 }
2609 }
2610
2611 // If this critter dies in sunlight, check & assess damage.
2612 if( has_flag( MF_SUNDEATH ) && g->is_in_sunlight( pos() ) ) {
2613 if( g->u.sees( *this ) ) {
2614 add_msg( m_good, _( "The %s burns horribly in the sunlight!" ), name() );
2615 }
2616 apply_damage( nullptr, bodypart_id( "torso" ), 100 );
2617 if( hp < 0 ) {
2618 hp = 0;
2619 }
2620 }
2621}

◆ process_one_effect()

void monster::process_one_effect ( effect &  it,
bool  is_new 
)
overrideprotectedvirtual

Processes monster-specific effects of an effect.

Implements Creature.

Definition at line 2488 of file monster.cpp.

2489{
2490 // Monsters don't get trait-based reduction, but they do get effect based reduction
2491 bool reduced = resists_effect( it );
2492 const auto get_effect = [&it, is_new]( const std::string & arg, bool reduced ) {
2493 if( is_new ) {
2494 return it.get_amount( arg, reduced );
2495 }
2496 return it.get_mod( arg, reduced );
2497 };
2498
2499 mod_speed_bonus( get_effect( "SPEED", reduced ) );
2500 mod_dodge_bonus( get_effect( "DODGE", reduced ) );
2501
2502 int val = get_effect( "HURT", reduced );
2503 if( val > 0 ) {
2504 if( is_new || it.activated( calendar::turn, "HURT", val, reduced, 1 ) ) {
2505 apply_damage( nullptr, bodypart_id( "torso" ), val );
2506 }
2507 }
2508
2509 const efftype_id &id = it.get_id();
2510 // TODO: MATERIALS use fire resistance
2511 if( it.impairs_movement() ) {
2512 effect_cache[MOVEMENT_IMPAIRED] = true;
2513 } else if( id == effect_onfire ) {
2514 int dam = 0;
2515 if( made_of( material_id( "veggy" ) ) ) {
2516 dam = rng( 10, 20 );
2517 } else if( made_of( material_id( "flesh" ) ) || made_of( material_id( "iflesh" ) ) ) {
2518 dam = rng( 5, 10 );
2519 }
2520
2521 dam -= get_armor_type( DT_HEAT, bodypart_id( "torso" ) );
2522 if( dam > 0 ) {
2523 apply_damage( nullptr, bodypart_id( "torso" ), dam );
2524 } else {
2525 it.set_duration( 0_turns );
2526 }
2527 } else if( id == effect_run ) {
2528 effect_cache[FLEEING] = true;
2529 } else if( id == effect_no_sight || id == effect_blind ) {
2530 effect_cache[VISION_IMPAIRED] = true;
2531 }
2532}

◆ process_triggers()

void monster::process_triggers ( )

1213{
1214 process_trigger( mon_trigger::STALK, [this]() {
1215 return anger > 0 && one_in( 5 ) ? 1 : 0;
1216 } );
1217
1218 process_trigger( mon_trigger::FIRE, [this]() {
1219 int ret = 0;
1220 for( const auto &p : g->m.points_in_radius( pos(), 3 ) ) {
1221 ret += 5 * g->m.get_field_intensity( p, fd_fire );
1222 }

1226 // Meat checking is disabled as for now.
1227 // It's hard to ever see it in action
1228 // and even harder to balance it without making it exploitable
1229

1231 if( morale < type->morale ) {
1232 morale++;
1233 } else {
1234 morale--;
1235 }

1241 } else {

2162{
2163 decrement_summon_timer();
2164 if( !is_hallucination() ) {
2165 for( const std::pair<const emit_id, time_duration> &e : type->emit_fields ) {
2166 if( !calendar::once_every( e.second ) ) {
2167 continue;
2168 }
2169 const emit_id emid = e.first;
2170 if( emid == emit_id( "emit_shock_cloud" ) ) {
2171 if( has_effect( effect_emp ) ) {
2172 continue; // don't emit electricity while EMPed
2173 } else if( has_effect( effect_supercharged ) ) {
2174 g->m.emit_field( pos(), emit_id( "emit_shock_cloud_big" ) );
2175 continue;
2176 }
2177 }
2178 g->m.emit_field( pos(), emid );
2179 }
2180 }
2181
2182 // Special attack cooldowns are updated here.
2183 // Loop through the monster's special attacks, same as monster::move.
2184 for( const auto &sp_type : type->special_attacks ) {
2185 const std::string &special_name = sp_type.first;
2186 const auto local_iter = special_attacks.find( special_name );
2187 if( local_iter == special_attacks.end() ) {
2188 continue;
2189 }
2190 mon_special_attack &local_attack_data = local_iter->second;
2191 if( !local_attack_data.enabled ) {
2192 continue;
2193 }
2194
2195 if( local_attack_data.cooldown > 0 ) {
2196 local_attack_data.cooldown--;
2197 }
2198 }
2199 // Persist grabs as long as there's an adjacent target.
2200 if( has_effect( effect_grabbing ) ) {
2201 for( auto &dest : g->m.points_in_radius( pos(), 1, 0 ) ) {
2202 const player *const p = g->critter_at<player>( dest );
2203 if( p && p->has_effect( effect_grabbed ) ) {
2204 add_effect( effect_grabbing, 2_turns );
2205 }
2206 }
2207 }
2208 // We update electrical fields here since they act every turn.
2209 if( has_flag( MF_ELECTRIC_FIELD ) ) {
2210 if( has_effect( effect_emp ) ) {
2211 if( calendar::once_every( 10_turns ) ) {
2212 sounds::sound( pos(), 5, sounds::sound_t::combat, _( "hummmmm." ), false, "humming", "electric" );
2213 }
2214 } else {
2215 for( const tripoint &zap : g->m.points_in_radius( pos(), 1 ) ) {
2216 const bool player_sees = g->u.sees( zap );
2217 const auto items = g->m.i_at( zap );
2218 for( const auto &item : items ) {
2219 if( item.made_of( LIQUID ) && item.flammable() ) { // start a fire!
2220 g->m.add_field( zap, fd_fire, 2, 1_minutes );
2221 sounds::sound( pos(), 30, sounds::sound_t::combat, _( "fwoosh!" ), false, "fire", "ignition" );
2222 break;
2223 }
2224 }
2225 if( zap != pos() ) {
2226 explosion_handler::emp_blast( zap ); // Fries electronics due to the intensity of the field
2227 }
2228 const auto t = g->m.ter( zap );
2229 if( t == ter_str_id( "t_gas_pump" ) || t == ter_str_id( "t_gas_pump_a" ) ) {
2230 if( one_in( 4 ) ) {
2231 explosion_handler::explosion( pos(), nullptr, 40, 0.8, true );
2232 if( player_sees ) {
2233 add_msg( m_warning, _( "The %s explodes in a fiery inferno!" ), g->m.tername( zap ) );
2234 }
2235 } else {

2237 add_msg( m_warning, _( "Lightning from %1$s engulfs the %2$s!" ), name(),
2238 g->m.tername( zap ) );
2239 }
2240 g->m.add_field( zap, fd_fire, 1, 2_turns );
2241 }
2242 }
2243 }
2244 if( get_weather().lightning_active && !has_effect( effect_supercharged ) &&
2245 g->m.is_outside( pos() ) ) {
2246 get_weather().lightning_active = false; // only one supercharge per strike
2247 sounds::sound( pos(), 300, sounds::sound_t::combat, _( "BOOOOOOOM!!!" ), false, "environment",

◆ push_to()

bool monster::push_to ( const tripoint &  p,
int  boost,
size_t  depth 
)

Try to push away whatever occupies p, then step in.

May recurse and try to make the creature at p push further.

Parameters
pLocation of pushed object
boostA bonus on the roll to represent a horde pushing from behind
depthNumber of recursions so far
Returns
True if we managed to push something and took its place, false otherwise.

Definition at line 1757 of file monmove.cpp.

1758{
1759 if( is_hallucination() ) {
1760 // Don't let hallucinations push, not even other hallucinations
1761 return false;
1762 }
1763
1764 if( !has_flag( MF_PUSH_MON ) || depth > 2 || has_effect( effect_pushed ) ) {
1765 return false;
1766 }
1767
1768 // TODO: Generalize this to Creature
1769 monster *const critter = g->critter_at<monster>( p );
1770 if( critter == nullptr || critter == this ||
1771 p == pos() || critter->movement_impaired() ) {
1772 return false;
1773 }
1774
1775 if( !can_move_to( p ) ) {
1776 return false;
1777 }
1778
1779 if( critter->is_hallucination() ) {
1780 // Kill the hallu, but return false so that the regular move_to is uses instead
1781 critter->die( nullptr );
1782 return false;
1783 }
1784
1785 // Stability roll of the pushed critter
1786 const int defend = critter->stability_roll();
1787 // Stability roll of the pushing zed
1788 const int attack = stability_roll() + boost;
1789 if( defend > attack ) {
1790 return false;
1791 }
1792
1793 const int movecost_from = 50 * g->m.move_cost( p );
1794 const int movecost_attacker = std::max( movecost_from, 200 - 10 * ( attack - defend ) );
1795 const tripoint dir = p - pos();
1796
1797 // Mark self as pushed to simplify recursive pushing
1798 add_effect( effect_pushed, 1_turns );
1799
1800 for( size_t i = 0; i < 6; i++ ) {
1801 const point d{ rng( -1, 1 ), rng( -1, 1 ) };
1802 if( d.x == 0 && d.y == 0 ) {
1803 continue;
1804 }
1805
1806 // Pushing forward is easier than pushing aside
1807 const int direction_penalty = std::abs( d.x - dir.x ) + std::abs( d.y - dir.y );
1808 if( direction_penalty > 2 ) {
1809 continue;
1810 }
1811
1812 tripoint dest( p + d );
1813 const int dest_movecost_from = 50 * g->m.move_cost( dest );
1814
1815 // Pushing into cars/windows etc. is harder
1816 const int movecost_penalty = g->m.move_cost( dest ) - 2;
1817 if( movecost_penalty <= -2 || get_map().obstructed_by_vehicle_rotation( p, dest ) ) {
1818 // Can't push into unpassable terrain
1819 continue;
1820 }
1821
1822 int roll = attack - ( defend + direction_penalty + movecost_penalty );
1823 if( roll < 0 ) {
1824 continue;
1825 }
1826
1827 Creature *critter_recur = g->critter_at( dest );
1828 if( !( critter_recur == nullptr || critter_recur->is_hallucination() ) ) {
1829 // Try to push recursively
1830 monster *mon_recur = dynamic_cast< monster * >( critter_recur );
1831 if( mon_recur == nullptr ) {
1832 continue;
1833 }
1834
1835 if( critter->push_to( dest, roll, depth + 1 ) ) {
1836 // The tile isn't necessarily free, need to check
1837 if( !g->critter_at( p ) ) {
1838 move_to( p );
1839 }
1840
1841 moves -= movecost_attacker;
1842
1843 // Don't knock down a creature that successfully
1844 // pushed another creature, just reduce moves
1845 critter->moves -= dest_movecost_from;
1846 return true;
1847 } else {
1848 return false;
1849 }
1850 }
1851
1852 critter_recur = g->critter_at( dest );
1853 if( critter_recur != nullptr ) {
1854 if( critter_recur->is_hallucination() ) {
1855 critter_recur->die( nullptr );
1856 }
1857 } else if( !critter->has_flag( MF_IMMOBILE ) ) {
1858 critter->setpos( dest );
1859 move_to( p );
1860 moves -= movecost_attacker;
1861 critter->add_effect( effect_downed, time_duration::from_turns( movecost_from / 100 + 1 ) );
1862 }
1863 return true;
1864 }
1865
1866 // Try to trample over a much weaker zed (or one with worse rolls)
1867 // Don't allow trampling with boost
1868 if( boost > 0 || attack < 2 * defend ) {
1869 return false;
1870 }
1871
1872 g->swap_critters( *critter, *this );
1873 critter->add_effect( effect_stunned, rng( 0_turns, 2_turns ) );
1874 // Only print the message when near player or it can get spammy
1875 if( rl_dist( g->u.pos(), pos() ) < 4 && g->u.sees( *critter ) ) {
1876 add_msg( m_warning, _( "The %1$s tramples %2$s" ),
1877 name(), critter->disp_name() );
1878 }
1879
1880 moves -= movecost_attacker;
1881 if( movecost_from > 100 ) {
1882 critter->add_effect( effect_downed, time_duration::from_turns( movecost_from / 100 + 1 ) );
1883 } else {
1884 critter->moves -= movecost_from;
1885 }
1886
1887 return true;
1888}

◆ rate_target()

float monster::rate_target ( Creature &  c,
float  best,
bool  smart = false 
) const

Definition at line 282 of file monmove.cpp.

283{
284 const auto d = rl_dist_fast( pos(), c.pos() );
285 if( d <= 0 ) {
286 return FLT_MAX;
287 }
288
289 // Check a very common and cheap case first
290 if( !smart && d >= best ) {
291 return FLT_MAX;
292 }
293
294 if( !sees( c ) ) {
295 return FLT_MAX;
296 }
297
298 if( !smart ) {
299 return int( d );
300 }
301
302 float power = c.power_rating();
303 monster *mon = dynamic_cast< monster * >( &c );
304 // Their attitude to us and not ours to them, so that bobcats won't get gunned down
305 if( mon != nullptr && mon->attitude_to( *this ) == Attitude::A_HOSTILE ) {
306 power += 2;
307 }
308
309 if( power > 0 ) {
310 return int( d ) / power;
311 }
312
313 return FLT_MAX;
314}

◆ refill_udders()

void monster::refill_udders ( )

Definition at line 450 of file monster.cpp.

451{
452 if( type->starting_ammo.empty() ) {
453 debugmsg( "monster %s has no starting ammo to refill udders", get_name() );
454 return;
455 }
456 if( ammo.empty() ) {
457 // legacy animals got empty ammo map, fill them up now if needed.
458 ammo[type->starting_ammo.begin()->first] = type->starting_ammo.begin()->second;
459 }
460 auto current_milk = ammo.find( itype_milk_raw );
461 if( current_milk == ammo.end() ) {
462 current_milk = ammo.find( itype_milk );
463 if( current_milk != ammo.end() ) {
464 // take this opportunity to update milk udders to raw_milk
465 ammo[itype_milk_raw] = current_milk->second;
466 // Erase old key-value from map
467 ammo.erase( current_milk );
468 }
469 }
470 // if we got here, we got milk.
471 if( current_milk->second == type->starting_ammo.begin()->second ) {
472 // already full up
473 return;
474 }
475 if( calendar::turn - udder_timer > 1_days ) {
476 // no point granularizing this really, you milk once a day.
477 ammo.begin()->second = type->starting_ammo.begin()->second;
478 udder_timer = calendar::turn;
479 }
480}
itype_milk

itype_milk_raw
static const itype_id itype_milk_raw("milk_raw")

1209{
1210 // TODO: Remove when scentmap is 3D
1211 if( std::abs( posz() - g->get_levz() ) > SCENT_MAP_Z_REACH ) {
1212 return { -1, -1, INT_MIN };
1213 }
1214
1215 const std::set<scenttype_id> &tracked_scents = type->scents_tracked;
1216 const std::set<scenttype_id> &ignored_scents = type->scents_ignored;
1217
1218 std::vector<tripoint> smoves;
1219
1220 int bestsmell = 10; // Squares with smell 0 are not eligible targets.
1221 int smell_threshold = 200; // Squares at or above this level are ineligible.
1222 if( has_flag( MF_KEENNOSE ) ) {
1223 bestsmell = 1;
1224 smell_threshold = 400;
1225 }
1226
1227 const bool fleeing = is_fleeing( g->u );
1228 if( fleeing ) {
1229 bestsmell = g->scent.get( pos() );
1230 }
1231
1232 tripoint next( -1, -1, posz() );
1233 if( ( !fleeing && g->scent.get( pos() ) > smell_threshold ) ||
1234 ( fleeing && bestsmell == 0 ) ) {
1235 return next;
1236 }
1237 const bool can_bash = bash_skill() > 0;
1238 for( const auto &dest : g->m.points_in_radius( pos(), 1, SCENT_MAP_Z_REACH ) ) {
1239 int smell = g->scent.get( dest );
1240 const scenttype_id &type_scent = g->scent.get_type( dest );
1241
1242 bool right_scent = false;
1243 // is the monster tracking this scent
1244 if( !tracked_scents.empty() ) {
1245 right_scent = tracked_scents.find( type_scent ) != tracked_scents.end();
1246 }
1247 //is this scent recognised by the monster species
1248 if( !type_scent.is_empty() ) {
1249 const std::set<species_id> &receptive_species = type_scent->receptive_species;
1250 const std::set<species_id> &monster_species = type->species;
1251 std::vector<species_id> v_intersection;
1252 std::set_intersection( receptive_species.begin(), receptive_species.end(), monster_species.begin(),
1253 monster_species.end(), std::back_inserter( v_intersection ) );
1254 if( !v_intersection.empty() ) {
1255 right_scent = true;
1256 }
1257 }
1258 // is the monster actually ignoring this scent
1259 if( !ignored_scents.empty() && ( ignored_scents.find( type_scent ) != ignored_scents.end() ) ) {
1260 right_scent = false;
1261 }
1262
1263 if( ( !fleeing && smell < bestsmell ) || ( fleeing && smell > bestsmell ) || !right_scent ) {
1264 continue;
1265 }
1266 if( g->m.valid_move( pos(), dest, can_bash, true ) &&
1267 ( ( can_move_to( dest ) && !get_map().obstructed_by_vehicle_rotation( pos(), dest ) ) ||
1268 ( dest == g->u.pos() ) ||
1269 ( can_bash && g->m.bash_rating( bash_estimate(), dest ) > 0 ) ) ) {
1270 if( ( !fleeing && smell > bestsmell ) || ( fleeing && smell < bestsmell ) ) {
1271 smoves.clear();
1272 smoves.push_back( dest );
1273 bestsmell = smell;
1274 } else if( ( !fleeing && smell == bestsmell ) || ( fleeing && smell == bestsmell ) ) {
1275 smoves.push_back( dest );
1276 }
1277 }
1278 }
1279
1280 return random_entry( smoves, next );
1281}
scent_type::receptive_species
std::set< species_id > receptive_species
Definition: scent_map.h:38

2131 veh.disp_name() );
2132 }

2134 shove_moves = std::max( shove_moves, shove_moves_minimal );
2135 this->mod_moves( -shove_moves );
2136 const tripoint destination_delta( -nearby_destination + remote_destination );

2138 clamp( destination_delta.y, -1, 1 ),
2139 clamp( destination_delta.z, -1, 1 ) );
2140 veh.skidding = true;
2141 veh.velocity = shove_velocity;

2143 if( shove_destination.z != 0 ) {
2144 veh.vertical_velocity = shove_destination.z < 0 ? -shove_velocity : +shove_velocity;
2145 }
2146 g->m.move_vehicle( veh, shove_destination, veh.face );
2147 }

How far the creature sees under the given light.

Places outside this range can

Parameters

959{
960 // Non-aquatic monsters can't see much when submerged
961 if( !can_see() || effect_cache[VISION_IMPAIRED] ||
962 ( is_underwater() && !swims() && !has_flag( MF_AQUATIC ) && !digging() ) ) {
963 return 1;
964 }
965 static const int default_daylight = default_daylight_level();

967 return type->vision_night;
968 } else if( light_level == default_daylight ) {
969 return type->vision_day;
970 }

972 type->vision_night;
973 range /= default_daylight;
974
975 return range;

◆ stumble()

void monster::stumble ( )

Stumble in a random direction, but with some caveats.

Definition at line 1893 of file monmove.cpp.

1894{
1895 // Only move every 10 turns.
1896 if( !one_in( 10 ) ) {
1897 return;
1898 }
1899
1900 map &here = get_map();
1901
1902 std::vector<tripoint> valid_stumbles;
1903 valid_stumbles.reserve( 11 );
1904 const bool avoid_water = has_flag( MF_NO_BREATHE ) && !swims() && !has_flag( MF_AQUATIC );
1905 for( const tripoint &dest : here.points_in_radius( pos(), 1 ) ) {
1906 if( dest != pos() ) {
1907 if( here.has_flag( TFLAG_RAMP_DOWN, dest ) ) {
1908 valid_stumbles.push_back( tripoint( dest.xy(), dest.z - 1 ) );
1909 } else if( here.has_flag( TFLAG_RAMP_UP, dest ) ) {
1910 valid_stumbles.push_back( tripoint( dest.xy(), dest.z + 1 ) );
1911 } else {
1912 valid_stumbles.push_back( dest );
1913 }
1914 }
1915 }
1916
1917 if( here.has_zlevels() ) {
1918 tripoint below( posx(), posy(), posz() - 1 );
1919 if( here.valid_move( pos(), below, false, true ) ) {
1920 valid_stumbles.push_back( below );
1921 }
1922 }
1923 while( !valid_stumbles.empty() && !is_dead() ) {
1924 const tripoint dest = random_entry_removed( valid_stumbles );
1925 if( can_move_to( dest ) &&
1926 //Stop zombies and other non-breathing monsters wandering INTO water
1927 //(Unless they can swim/are aquatic)
1928 //But let them wander OUT of water if they are there.
1929 !( avoid_water &&
1930 here.has_flag( TFLAG_SWIMMABLE, dest ) &&
1931 !here.has_flag( TFLAG_SWIMMABLE, pos() ) ) &&
1932 ( g->critter_at( dest, is_hallucination() ) == nullptr ) ) {
1933 if( move_to( dest, true, false ) ) {
1934 break;
1935 }
1936 }
1937 }
1938}

◆ try_reproduce()

void monster::try_reproduce ( )

Definition at line 391 of file monster.cpp.

392{
393 if( !reproduces ) {
394 return;
395 }
396 // This can happen if the monster type has changed (from reproducing to non-reproducing monster)
397 if( !type->baby_timer ) {
398 return;
399 }
400
401 if( !baby_timer ) {
402 // Assume this is a freshly spawned monster (because baby_timer is not set yet), set the point when it reproduce to somewhere in the future.
403 baby_timer.emplace( calendar::turn + *type->baby_timer );
404 }
405
406 bool season_spawn = false;
407 bool season_match = true;
408
409 // only 50% of animals should reproduce
410 bool female = one_in( 2 );
411 for( auto &elem : type->baby_flags ) {
412 if( elem == "SUMMER" || elem == "WINTER" || elem == "SPRING" || elem == "AUTUMN" ) {
413 season_spawn = true;
414 }
415 }
416
417 // add a decreasing chance of additional spawns when "catching up" an existing animal
418 int chance = -1;
419 while( true ) {
420 if( *baby_timer > calendar::turn ) {
421 return;
422 }
423
424 if( season_spawn ) {
425 season_match = false;
426 for( auto &elem : type->baby_flags ) {
427 if( ( season_of_year( *baby_timer ) == SUMMER && elem == "SUMMER" ) ||
428 ( season_of_year( *baby_timer ) == WINTER && elem == "WINTER" ) ||
429 ( season_of_year( *baby_timer ) == SPRING && elem == "SPRING" ) ||
430 ( season_of_year( *baby_timer ) == AUTUMN && elem == "AUTUMN" ) ) {
431 season_match = true;
432 }
433 }
434 }
435
436 chance += 2;
437 if( season_match && female && one_in( chance ) ) {
438 int spawn_cnt = rng( 1, type->baby_count );
439 if( type->baby_monster ) {
440 g->m.add_spawn( type->baby_monster, spawn_cnt, pos() );
441 } else {
442 g->m.add_item_or_charges( pos(), item( type->baby_egg, *baby_timer, spawn_cnt ), true );
443 }
444 }
445
446 *baby_timer += *type->baby_timer;
447 }
448}

int baby_count

◆ try_upgrade()

void monster::try_upgrade ( bool  pin_time)

Definition at line 332 of file monster.cpp.

333{
334 if( !can_upgrade() ) {
335 return;
336 }
337
338 const int current_day = to_days<int>( calendar::turn - calendar::turn_zero );
339 //This should only occur when a monster is created or upgraded to a new form
340 if( upgrade_time < 0 ) {
341 upgrade_time = next_upgrade_time();
342 if( upgrade_time < 0 ) {
343 return;
344 }
345 if( pin_time || type->age_grow > 0 ) {
346 // offset by today, always true for growing creatures
347 upgrade_time += current_day;
348 } else {
349 // offset by starting season
350 // TODO: revisit this and make it simpler
351 upgrade_time += to_days<int>( calendar::start_of_cataclysm - calendar::turn_zero );
352 }
353 }
354
355 // Here we iterate until we either are before upgrade_time or can't upgrade any more.
356 // This is so that late into game new monsters can 'catch up' with all that half-life
357 // upgrades they'd get if we were simulating whole world.
358 while( true ) {
359 if( upgrade_time > current_day ) {
360 // not yet
361 return;
362 }
363
364 if( type->upgrade_into ) {
365 //If we upgrade into a blacklisted monster, treat it as though we are non-upgradeable
366 if( MonsterGroupManager::monster_is_blacklisted( type->upgrade_into ) ) {
367 return;
368 }
369 poly( type->upgrade_into );
370 } else {
371 const mtype_id &new_type = MonsterGroupManager::GetRandomMonsterFromGroup( type->upgrade_group );
372 if( new_type ) {
373 poly( new_type );
374 }
375 }
376
377 if( !upgrades ) {
378 // upgraded into a non-upgradeable monster
379 return;
380 }
381
382 const int next_upgrade = next_upgrade_time();
383 if( next_upgrade < 0 ) {
384 // hit never_upgrade
385 return;
386 }
387 upgrade_time += next_upgrade;
388 }
389}

◆ turns_to_reach()

int monster::turns_to_reach ( const point &  p)

Definition at line 2055 of file monmove.cpp.

2056{
2057 // HACK: This function is a(n old) temporary hack that should soon be removed
2058 auto path = g->m.route( pos(), tripoint( p, posz() ), get_pathfinding_settings() );
2059 if( path.empty() ) {
2060 return 999;
2061 }
2062
2063 double turns = 0.;
2064 for( size_t i = 0; i < path.size(); i++ ) {
2065 const tripoint &next = path[i];
2066 if( g->m.impassable( next ) ) {
2067 // No bashing through, it looks stupid when you go back and find
2068 // the doors intact.
2069 return 999;
2070 } else if( i == 0 ) {
2071 turns += static_cast<double>( calc_movecost( pos(), next ) ) / get_speed();
2072 } else {
2073 turns += static_cast<double>( calc_movecost( path[i - 1], next ) ) / get_speed();
2074 }
2075 }
2076
2077 return static_cast<int>( turns + .9 ); // Halve (to get turns) and round up
2078}

References calc_movecost(), g, get_pathfinding_settings(), Creature::get_speed(), path, pos(), and posz().

void monster::wander_to ( const tripoint &  p,
int  f 
)

Set p as wander destination.

This will cause the monster to slowly move towards the destination, unless there is an overriding smell or plan.

◆ will_move_to()

bool monster::will_move_to ( const tripoint &  p) const

Definition at line 119 of file monmove.cpp.

120{
121 if( g->m.impassable( p ) ) {
122 if( digging() ) {
123 if( !g->m.has_flag( "BURROWABLE", p ) ) {
124 return false;
125 }
126 } else if( !( can_climb() && g->m.has_flag( "CLIMBABLE", p ) ) ) {
127 return false;
128 }
129 }
130
131 if( ( !can_submerge() && !flies() ) && g->m.has_flag( TFLAG_DEEP_WATER, p ) ) {
132 return false;
133 }
134
135 if( digs() && !g->m.has_flag( "DIGGABLE", p ) && !g->m.has_flag( "BURROWABLE", p ) ) {
136 return false;
137 }
138
139 if( has_flag( MF_AQUATIC ) && !g->m.has_flag( "SWIMMABLE", p ) ) {
140 return false;
141 }
142
143 if( has_flag( MF_SUNDEATH ) && g->is_in_sunlight( p ) ) {
144 return false;
145 }
146
147 if( get_size() > MS_MEDIUM && g->m.has_flag_ter( TFLAG_SMALL_PASSAGE, p ) ) {
148 return false; // if a large critter, can't move through tight passages
149 }
150
151 // Various avoiding behaviors.
152
153 bool avoid_fire = has_flag( MF_AVOID_FIRE );
154 bool avoid_fall = has_flag( MF_AVOID_FALL );
155 bool avoid_simple = has_flag( MF_AVOID_DANGER_1 );
156 bool avoid_complex = has_flag( MF_AVOID_DANGER_2 );
157 /*
158 * Because some avoidance behaviors are supersets of others,
159 * we can cascade through the implications. Complex implies simple,
160 * and simple implies fire and fall.
161 * unfortunately, fall does not necessarily imply fire, nor the converse.
162 */
163 if( avoid_complex ) {
164 avoid_simple = true;
165 }
166 if( avoid_simple ) {
167 avoid_fire = true;
168 avoid_fall = true;
169 }
170
171 // technically this will shortcut in evaluation from fire or fall
172 // before hitting simple or complex but this is more explicit
173 if( avoid_fire || avoid_fall || avoid_simple || avoid_complex ) {
174 const ter_id target = g->m.ter( p );
175
176 // Don't enter lava if we have any concept of heat being bad
177 if( avoid_fire && target == t_lava ) {
178 return false;
179 }
180
181 if( avoid_fall ) {
182 // Don't throw ourselves off cliffs if we have a concept of falling
183 if( !g->m.has_floor( p ) && !flies() ) {
184 return false;
185 }
186
187 // Don't enter open pits ever unless tiny, can fly or climb well
188 if( !( type->size == MS_TINY || can_climb() ) &&
189 ( target == t_pit || target == t_pit_spiked || target == t_pit_glass ) ) {
190 return false;
191 }
192 }
193
194 // Some things are only avoided if we're not attacking
195 if( attitude( &g->u ) != MATT_ATTACK ) {
196 // Sharp terrain is ignored while attacking
197 if( avoid_simple && g->m.has_flag( "SHARP", p ) &&
198 !( type->size == MS_TINY || flies() ) ) {
199 return false;
200 }
201 }
202
203 const field &target_field = g->m.field_at( p );
204
205 // Higher awareness is needed for identifying these as threats.
206 if( avoid_complex ) {
207 const trap &target_trap = g->m.tr_at( p );
208 // Don't enter any dangerous fields
209 if( is_dangerous_fields( target_field ) ) {
210 return false;
211 }
212 // Don't step on any traps (if we can see)
213 if( has_flag( MF_SEES ) && !target_trap.is_benign() && g->m.has_floor( p ) ) {
214 return false;
215 }
216 }
217
218 // Without avoid_complex, only fire and electricity are checked for field avoidance.
219 if( avoid_fire && target_field.find_field( fd_fire ) ) {
220 return false;
221 }
222 if( avoid_simple && target_field.find_field( fd_electricity ) ) {
223 return false;
224 }
225 }
226
227 return true;
228}
Creature::is_dangerous_fields
bool is_dangerous_fields(const field &fld) const
Returns true if there is a field in the field set that is dangerous to us.
